en: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
ny: Izi ndizofala ku UK koma chilungamo cha ku Scottish chimagwira ntchito mosiyana ndipo makhothi amawona kufalitsa zithunzi kukhala kokondera.

en: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
ny: Pulofesa Pamela Ferguson wa pa yunivesite ya Dundee anati "atolankhani akuwoneka kuti akuyenda moopsa ngati akufalitsa zithunzi ndi zina za anthu okayikira."

en: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
ny: Ofesi ya Crown, yomwe imayang'anira milandu yonse, yauza atolankhani kuti palibenso ndemanga yomwe ingachitike mpaka atatsutsidwa.

en: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
ny: Chikalatacho, malinga ndi kutayikirako, chidzanena za mkangano wa malire, womwe Palestine akufuna malinga ndi malire nkhondo yapakati pa 1967 isanachitike.

en: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
ny: Nkhani zina zomwe zikunenedwazo zikuphatikiza mkhalidwe wamtsogolo wa Yerusalemu womwe ndi wopatulika kumitundu yonse ndi nkhani ya Chigwa cha Yorodani.

en: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
ny: Israeli ikufuna kuti asilikali apitirize kukhalapo m'chigwachi kwa zaka khumi kamodzi mgwirizano usayinidwe pamene PA ikuvomera kusiya kukhalapo kwa zaka zisanu zokha.

en: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
ny: Owombera mu mayesero owonjezera owononga tizilombo amayenera kuyang'aniridwa mosamala ndi oyang'anira, pamene mayeserowo ankayang'aniridwa ndikuwunikiridwa bwino.

en: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
ny: Mu mgwirizano wa NPWS ndi Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, odzipereka oyenerera analembedwa, pansi pa pulogalamu yosaka nyama ya Sporting Shooters Association.

en: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
ny: Malinga ndi a Mick O'Flynn, Woyang'anira Woyang'anira Park Conservation and Heritage ndi NPWS, owombera anayi omwe adasankhidwa kuti ayambe kuwombera koyamba adalandira malangizo achitetezo ndi maphunziro.

en: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
ny: A Martelly adalumbirira Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) ya mamembala asanu ndi anayi dzulo.

en: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
ny: Ndi CEP yachisanu ya Martelly pazaka zinayi.

en: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
ny: Mwezi watha bungwe la pulezidenti lidavomereza kuti a CEP ayambe kusiya ntchito ngati njira imodzi yolimbikitsira zisankho zatsopano.

en: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
ny: Komitiyi inali yankho la a Martelly pa ziwonetsero zotsutsana ndi boma zomwe zidayamba mu October.

en: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
ny: Ziwonetsero zachiwawa zomwe nthawi zina zidayamba chifukwa cholephera kuchita zisankho, zina kuyambira 2011.

en: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
ny: Pafupifupi milandu 60 ya kulephera kwa ma iPods kutenthedwa kwamoto kwanenedwa, zomwe zidayambitsa moto sikisi ndikusiya anthu anayi akupsa pang'ono.

en: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
ny: Unduna woona za chuma, malonda ndi mafakitale ku Japan (METI) wati wakhala ukudziwa za ngozi 27 zokhudzana ndi zidazi.

en: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
ny: Sabata yatha, METI idalengeza kuti Apple idadziwitsanso za 34 zowonjezera zowonjezera, zomwe kampaniyo idazitcha "zosawopsa."

en: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
ny: Undunawu udayankha ponena kuti kuyimitsa kwa Apple lipotilo "ndikomvetsa chisoni kwambiri."

en: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
ny: Chivomezicho chinagunda Mariana nthawi ya 07:19 am nthawi ya komweko (09:19 pm GMT Lachisanu).

en: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
ny: Ofesi yoyang'anira zadzidzidzi yaku Northern Marianas idati palibe zowonongeka zomwe zanenedwa mdzikolo.

en: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
ny: Komanso Pacific Tsunami Warning Center inanena kuti panalibe chisonyezero cha Tsunami.

en: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
ny: Wapolisi wakale waku Philippines watsekereza alendo odzaona ku Hong Kong powabera basi ku Manila, likulu la dziko la Philippines.

en: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
ny: Rolando Mendoza anawombera mfuti yake ya M16 kwa alendo.

en: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
ny: Anthu angapo ogwidwa apulumutsidwa ndipo osachepera asanu ndi mmodzi atsimikiziridwa kuti amwalira mpaka pano.

en: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
ny: Anthu 6 ogwidwa, kuphatikizapo ana ndi okalamba, anamasulidwa msangamsanga, monga momwe anachitira ojambula a ku Philippines.

en: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
ny: Pambuyo pake ojambulawo adalowa m'malo mwa mayi wina wokalamba chifukwa amafunikira chimbudzi. Mendoza anaphedwa.

en: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
ny: Liggins adatsata mapazi a abambo ake ndikulowa ntchito yachipatala.

en: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
ny: Anaphunzitsidwa zachipatala ndipo anayamba kugwira ntchito ku Auckland's National Women's Hospital mu 1959.

en: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
ny: Pamene anali kugwira ntchito kuchipatala, Liggins anayamba kufufuza za kubadwa msanga panthawi yake yopuma.

en: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
ny: Kafukufuku wake anasonyeza kuti ngati atapatsidwa mankhwala otchedwa hormone amafulumizitsa kukula kwa mapapo a mwana wosabadwayo.

en: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
ny: Xinhua inanena kuti ofufuza aboma adapeza zojambulira ndege ziwiri za "black box" Lachitatu.

en: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
ny: Omenya nawo ma wrestler adaperekanso ulemu kwa Luna.

en: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
ny: Tommy Dreamer anati "Luna anali Mfumukazi yoyamba ya Extreme. Mtsogoleri wanga woyamba. Luna anamwalira usiku wa miyezi iwiri. Wokongola kwambiri monga iye. Mkazi wamphamvu."

en: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
ny: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels adanena kuti "Luna anali wopusa ngati ine ... mwinanso kwambiri ... kumukonda ndipo adzamusowa ... ndikuyembekeza kuti ali pamalo abwino."

en: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
ny: Mwa anthu 1,400 omwe adafunsidwa chisankho cha feduro cha 2010 chisanachitike, omwe amatsutsa kuti Australia kukhala repabuliki adakula ndi 8 peresenti kuyambira 2008.

en: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
ny: Prime Minister wosamalira Julia Gillard adati panthawi yachisankho cha feduro cha 2010 amakhulupirira kuti dziko la Australia liyenera kukhala republic kumapeto kwa ulamuliro wa Mfumukazi Elizabeth II.

en: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
ny: 34 mwa anthu 100 aliwonse omwe adachita kafukufukuyu ali ndi lingaliro ili, akufuna kuti Mfumukazi Elizabeth II akhale mfumu yomaliza ya Australia.

en: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
ny: Kumapeto kwa kafukufukuyu, 29 peresenti ya omwe adafunsidwa amakhulupirira kuti Australia iyenera kukhala lipabuliki posachedwa, pomwe 31 peresenti amakhulupirira kuti Australia siyenera kukhala dziko.

en: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
ny: Wopambana mendulo ya golidi wa Olympic adayenera kusambira mu freestyle ya 100m ndi 200m komanso pamipikisano itatu pamasewera a Commonwealth Games, koma chifukwa cha madandaulo ake olimba ake akhala akukayikira.

en: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
ny: Walephera kumwa mankhwala ofunikira kuti athetse ululu wake chifukwa amaletsedwa ku Masewera.

en: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
ny: Curtis Cooper, pulofesa wa masamu ndi sayansi yamakompyuta ku University of Central Missouri, wapeza nambala yayikulu kwambiri yomwe imadziwika mpaka pano pa Januware 25.

en: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
ny: Anthu angapo adatsimikizira kupezeka kwawo pogwiritsa ntchito zida ndi mapulogalamu osiyanasiyana koyambirira kwa February ndipo zidalengezedwa Lachiwiri.

en: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
ny: N’kutheka kuti madzi a m’nyanja ya comet ndi amene ankatumiza madzi padziko lapansi komanso zinthu zina zimene zimapanga mapulotini komanso kukhala ndi moyo.

en: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
ny: Asayansi akuyembekeza kuti amvetsetsa momwe mapulaneti amapangidwira, makamaka momwe Dziko lapansi limapangidwira, popeza ma comets adawombana ndi Dziko Lapansi kalekale.

en: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
ny: Cuomo, 53, adayamba ubwanamkubwa koyambirira kwa chaka chino ndipo adasaina chikalata mwezi watha chololeza maukwati a amuna kapena akazi okhaokha.

en: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".
ny: Iye adatchula mphekeserazo kuti ndi "nkhani zandale komanso kupusa".

en: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
ny: Akuyembekezeka kukhala Purezidenti mu 2016.

en: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
ny: NextGen ndi njira yomwe FAA imati imalola kuti ndege ziziyenda pang'onopang'ono ndikupulumutsa mamiliyoni a magaloni amafuta chaka chilichonse ndikuchepetsa kutulutsa mpweya.

en: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
ny: Amagwiritsa ntchito ukadaulo wopangidwa ndi satelayiti kusiyana ndi ukadaulo wakale wa radar pansi kuti alole oyang'anira kayendetsedwe ka ndege kuloza ndege molondola kwambiri komanso kupereka chidziwitso cholondola kwa oyendetsa ndege.

en: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
ny: Palibe mayendedwe owonjezera omwe akuyikidwa ndipo masitima apamtunda sayima ku Wembley, komanso malo oimika magalimoto ndi malo oimikapo magalimoto sakupezeka pansi.

en: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
ny: Mantha akusowa kwa mayendedwe adapangitsa kuti masewerawa akakamizidwe kusewerera zitseko popanda otsatira a timuyi.

en: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
ny: Kafukufuku yemwe adasindikizidwa Lachinayi mu nyuzipepala ya Science inanena za kupangidwa kwa mtundu watsopano wa mbalame kuzilumba za Ecuadorean Galápagos.

en: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
ny: Ofufuza a ku yunivesite ya Princeton ku United States ndi ku yunivesite ya Uppsala ku Sweden ananena kuti zamoyo zatsopanozi zinasintha m’mibadwo iwiri yokha, ngakhale kuti zimenezi zinkachitika kuti zimatenga nthawi yaitali, chifukwa cha kuswana pakati pa mbalame yotchedwa Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, ndi cactus. finch, Geospisa conirostris.

en: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
ny: Golide akhoza kupangidwa mosiyanasiyana. Ikhoza kukulungidwa m'mawonekedwe ang'onoang'ono.

en: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
ny: Itha kukokedwa kukhala waya woonda, womwe ukhoza kupindika ndi kuwomba. Ikhoza kumenyedwa kapena kukulungidwa mu mapepala.

en: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".
ny: Itha kukhala yopyapyala kwambiri, ndikumamatira pazitsulo zina. Zitha kukhala zoonda kwambiri moti nthawi zina zinkagwiritsidwa ntchito kukongoletsa zithunzi zojambula pamanja m'mabuku otchedwa "manuscripts owala".

en: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
ny: Izi zimatchedwa pH ya mankhwala. Mutha kupanga chizindikiro pogwiritsa ntchito madzi ofiira a kabichi.

en: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
ny: Madzi a kabichi amasintha mtundu malinga ndi momwe mankhwalawa aliri acidic kapena alkaline.

en: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
ny: Mulingo wa pH umawonetsedwa ndi kuchuluka kwa ayoni a haidrojeni (H mu pH) mu mankhwala oyesedwa.

en: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ny: Ma hydrogen ions ndi ma pulotoni omwe ma elekitironi amawachotsera (popeza maatomu a Hydrogen amakhala ndi pulotoni imodzi ndi elekitironi imodzi).

en: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
ny: Sakanizani ufa awiriwo owuma pamodzi ndiyeno, ndi manja oyera onyowa, finyani kukhala mpira.

en: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
ny: Chinyezi chomwe chili m'manja mwanu chidzakhudzidwa ndi zigawo zakunja, zomwe zimamveka zoseketsa ndikupanga mtundu wa chipolopolo.

en: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
ny: Mizinda ya Harappa ndi Mohenjo-daro inali ndi chimbudzi chotaya madzi pafupifupi m’nyumba iliyonse, chomangika ndi chimbudzi chapamwamba kwambiri.

en: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
ny: Zotsalira za zonyansa zapezeka m'nyumba za mizinda ya Minoan ya Krete ndi Santorini ku Greece.

en: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
ny: Panalinso zimbudzi zakale ku Egypt, Persia ndi China. M’chitukuko cha Aroma, zimbudzi nthaŵi zina zinali mbali ya nyumba zosambiramo zapagulu kumene amuna ndi akazi anali pamodzi mosakanikirana.

en: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
ny: Mukaimbira foni munthu yemwe ali kutali kwambiri, mumagwiritsa ntchito satelayiti.

en: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
ny: Setilaiti yomwe ili mumlengalenga imayimba foni kenako ndikuyiwonetsera pansi, pafupifupi nthawi yomweyo.

en: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
ny: Setilaitiyi inatumizidwa mumlengalenga ndi roketi. Asayansi amagwiritsa ntchito makina oonera zinthu zakuthambo m’mlengalenga chifukwa mlengalenga wa dziko lapansi umasokoneza kuwala ndi mmene timaonera zinthu.

en: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
ny: Pamafunika roketi yaikulu yotalika mamita 100 kuti iike satellite kapena telesikopu mumlengalenga.

en: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
ny: Gudumu lasintha dziko m'njira zosaneneka. Chinthu chachikulu chomwe gudumu latichitira chimatipatsa mayendedwe osavuta komanso othamanga.

en: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
ny: Yatibweretsera sitima, galimoto, ndi zipangizo zina zambiri zoyendera.

en: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
ny: Pansi pawo pali amphaka ang'onoang'ono omwe amadya nyama zapakatikati kuyambira akalulu mpaka agwape ndi agwape.

en: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
ny: Pomaliza, pali amphaka ang'onoang'ono (kuphatikiza amphaka otayirira) omwe amadya nyama zazing'ono zambiri monga tizilombo, makoswe, abuluzi, ndi mbalame.

en: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
ny: Chinsinsi cha kupambana kwawo ndi lingaliro la niche, ntchito yapadera yomwe kamba iliyonse imakhala nayo yomwe imalepheretsa kupikisana ndi ena.

en: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
ny: Mikango ndi amphaka ambiri omwe amacheza nawo, amakhala m'magulu akuluakulu otchedwa prides.

en: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
ny: Kunyada kumapangidwa ndi amuna akuluakulu amodzi kapena atatu, pamodzi ndi akazi ndi ana aakazi ochuluka mpaka makumi atatu.

en: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
ny: Akazi nthawi zambiri amakhala ogwirizana kwambiri, pokhala banja lalikulu la alongo ndi aakazi.

en: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ny: Kunyada kwa mikango kumakhala ngati mapaketi a mimbulu kapena agalu, nyama zomwe zimafanana modabwitsa ndi mikango (koma osati amphaka ena akulu) pamakhalidwe, komanso zakupha kwambiri nyama zawo.

en: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
ny: Kambukuyo ali wothamanga kwambiri, amatha kukwera (ngakhale kuti sali bwino), kusambira, kudumpha mtunda wautali ndi kukoka mphamvu kuwirikiza kasanu mphamvu ya munthu wamphamvu.

en: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
ny: Kambuku ali m’gulu limodzi ( Genus Panthera ) ndi mikango, nyalugwe, ndi jaguar. Amphaka anayiwa ndi okhawo omwe amatha kubangula.

en: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
ny: Kubangula kwa nyalugwe sikufanana ndi kubangula kwa mkango, koma kumamveka ngati chiganizo cha mawu aukali.

en: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
ny: Ocelots amakonda kudya nyama zazing'ono. Adzagwira anyani, njoka, makoswe ndi mbalame ngati angathe. Pafupifupi nyama zonse zomwe ocelot amasaka ndi zazing'ono kwambiri kuposa momwe zilili.

en: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
ny: Asayansi akuganiza kuti ocelots amatsata ndikupeza nyama zodyera (zolanda) mwa fungo, kununkhiza komwe zakhala pansi.

en: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
ny: Amatha kuwona bwino mumdima ndi masomphenya ausiku, ndikuyenda mobisa, nawonso. Ocelots amasaka nyama zawo pophatikizana ndi zowazungulira kenako ndikukantha nyama zawo.

en: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
ny: Pamene gulu laling’ono la zamoyo (anthu oŵerengeka) lilekanitsidwa ndi anthu ambiri amene linachokera (monga ngati likuyenda pamwamba pa mapiri kapena mtsinje, kapena ngati lisamukira ku chisumbu chatsopano kotero kuti silingafike mosavuta. bwerera mmbuyo) nthawi zambiri amadzipeza ali m'malo osiyana ndi omwe analimo kale.

en: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
ny: Malo atsopanowa ali ndi zothandizira zosiyanasiyana ndi mpikisano wosiyana, kotero kuti anthu atsopano adzafunika mawonekedwe osiyanasiyana kapena kusintha kuti akhale mpikisano wamphamvu kuposa zomwe amafunikira kale.

en: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
ny: Chiwerengero choyambirira sichinasinthe nkomwe, amafunikirabe kusintha komweko monga kale.

en: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
ny: M’kupita kwa nthaŵi, pamene anthu atsopanowo ayamba kuzoloŵerana ndi malo awo atsopano, amayamba kuoneka mocheperapo mofanana ndi anthu ena onse.

en: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
ny: Pamapeto pake, patapita zaka masauzande kapenanso mamiliyoni ambiri, anthu aŵiriwo adzawoneka mosiyana kwambiri moti sangatchulidwe kuti ndi mitundu yofanana.

en: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ny: Njirayi timayitcha speciation, zomwe zimangotanthauza kupangidwa kwa zamoyo zatsopano. Speciation ndi zotsatira zosalephereka komanso gawo lofunika kwambiri la chisinthiko.

en: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
ny: Zomera zimapanga mpweya umene anthu amapuma, ndipo zimatenga mpweya woipa umene anthu amautulutsa (ndiko kuti, kupuma).

en: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
ny: Zomera zimapanga chakudya chawo kuchokera kudzuwa pogwiritsa ntchito photosynthesis. Amaperekanso mthunzi.

en: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ny: Timamanga nyumba zathu ndi zomera ndi kupanga zovala kuchokera ku zomera. Zakudya zambiri zomwe timadya ndi zomera. Popanda zomera, nyama sizikanatha kukhala ndi moyo.

en: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
ny: Mosasaurus anali adani apamwamba kwambiri pa nthawi yake, choncho sankaopa kalikonse, kupatula amosasa ena.

en: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
ny: Zibwano zake zazitali zinali zodzaza ndi mano akuthwa oposa 70, limodzi ndi nsonga yowonjezereka padenga la kamwa yake, kutanthauza kuti panalibe kuthaŵa chilichonse chodutsa njira yake.

en: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
ny: Sitikudziwa motsimikiza, koma mwina linali ndi lilime la mphanda. Chakudya chake chinali akamba, nsomba zazikulu, nyama zina za mosasa, ndipo mwina ankadya anthu.

en: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
ny: Idamenyanso chilichonse cholowa m'madzi; ngakhale dinosaur wamkulu ngati T. rex sangafanane nawo.

en: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
ny: Ngakhale kuti chakudya chawo chochuluka chikanakhala chozoloŵereka kwa ife, Aroma anali ndi gawo lawo la maphwando achilendo kapena achilendo, kuphatikizapo nguluwe, nkhanga, nkhono, ndi mtundu wina wa makoswe wotchedwa dormouse.

en: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
ny: Kusiyana kwina n’kwakuti pamene anthu osauka ndi mayiyo ankadya chakudya chawo atakhala pamipando, anthu olemerawo ankakonda kudyera limodzi mapwando kumene ankakhala m’mbali mwawo kwinaku akudya chakudya chawo.

en: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
ny: Zakudya zamakedzana za ku Roma sizikanaphatikizapo zakudya zomwe zinabwera ku Ulaya kuchokera ku America kapena ku Asia m'zaka mazana angapo zapitazi.

en: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, analibe chimanga, tomato, mbatata, koko, ndiponso panalibe Mroma wakale amene analawapo turkey.

en: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
ny: Ababulo anamanga mulungu wawo aliyense kachisi wamkulu amene ankaonedwa kuti ndi kwawo kwa mulunguyo.

en: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
ny: Anthu ankapereka nsembe kwa milunguyo ndipo ansembe ankayesetsa kusamalira milunguyo kudzera m’miyambo ndi mapwando.

en: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
ny: Kachisi aliyense anali ndi bwalo la kachisi lotseguka ndiyeno malo opatulika amkati mmene ansembe okha ankaloŵamo.

en: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
ny: Nthawi zina nsanja zapadera zooneka ngati piramidi, zotchedwa ziggurats, zimamangidwa kuti zikhale gawo la akachisi.

en: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
ny: Pamwamba pa nsanjayo panali malo opatulika a mulungu.

en: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
ny: M’nyengo yofunda ya ku Middle East, nyumbayo sinali yofunika kwambiri.

en: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
ny: Zambiri za moyo wa banja lachihebri zidachitika poyera.

en: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
ny: Akazi anali kuphika pabwalo; masitolo anali otsegula owerengera akuyang'ana mumsewu. Mwala unkagwiritsidwa ntchito pomanga nyumba.

en: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
ny: M’dziko la Kanani munalibe nkhalango zikuluzikulu, choncho mitengo inali yokwera mtengo kwambiri.

en: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
ny: Greenland idakhazikika pang'ono. M’nkhani za ku Norse amanena kuti Erik the Red anathamangitsidwa ku Iceland chifukwa cha kupha munthu, ndipo pamene anali kupita kumadzulo, anapeza Greenland ndipo anaitcha Greenland.

en: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
ny: Koma mosasamala kanthu za zimene anapeza, mafuko a Eskimo anali atakhala kale kumeneko panthaŵiyo.

en: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ny: Ngakhale dziko lililonse linali la Scandinavia, panali kusiyana kwakukulu pakati pa anthu, mafumu, miyambo ndi mbiri ya Denmark, Sweden, Norway ndi Iceland.

en: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
ny: Ngati munaonerapo kanema wa National Treasure, mungaganize kuti mapu amtengo wapatali analembedwa kumbuyo kwa Declaration of Independence.

en: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
ny: Komabe, zimenezo si zoona. Ngakhale kuti pali chinachake cholembedwa kumbuyo kwa chikalatacho, si mapu amtengo wapatali.

en: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
ny: Kumbuyo kwa Declaration of Independence kunali mawu akuti "Original Declaration of Independence ya 4th July 1776". Mawuwo amawonekera pansi pa chikalatacho, mozondoka.

en: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
ny: Ngakhale kuti palibe amene akudziwa motsimikiza amene analemba, zimadziwika kuti kumayambiriro kwa moyo wake, chikalata chachikulu cha zikopa (cholemera 29¾ mainchesi ndi mainchesi 24½) chinakulungidwa kuti chisungidwe.

en: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
ny: Chifukwa chake, zikuoneka kuti zolembazo zidawonjezedwa ngati chizindikiro.

en: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
ny: Kufika kwa D-Day ndi nkhondo zotsatirazi zidamasula kumpoto kwa France, koma kumwera kunalibe ufulu.

en: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
ny: Analamulidwa ndi "Vichy" French. Awa anali anthu a ku France amene anapanga mtendere ndi Ajeremani mu 1940 ndipo anagwira ntchito ndi oukirawo m’malo molimbana nawo.

en: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
ny: Pa 15 August 1940, Allies adagonjetsa kum'mwera kwa France, nkhondoyi inatchedwa "Operation Dragoon".

en: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
ny: M'milungu iwiri yokha asilikali aku America ndi Free French anali atamasula kumwera kwa France ndipo anali kutembenukira ku Germany.

en: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
ny: Chitukuko ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu omwe ali ndi gulu lalikulu la anthu omwe amakhala ndikugwira ntchito mogwirizana, gulu.

en: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
ny: Mawu akuti chitukuko amachokera ku Latin civilis, kutanthauza kuti civil, yokhudzana ndi Latin civis, kutanthauza nzika, ndi civitas, kutanthauza mzinda kapena mzinda, komanso momwe zimatanthauzira kukula kwa anthu.

en: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
ny: Mizinda ndi zotsogola za mayiko. Chikhalidwe chachitukuko chimatanthawuza kupatsirana chidziwitso m'mibadwo ingapo, chikhalidwe chokhazikika komanso kufalitsa mwachilungamo.

en: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
ny: Zikhalidwe zazing'ono nthawi zambiri zimatha popanda kusiya umboni wa mbiri yakale ndipo zimalephera kuzindikirika ngati zitukuko zoyenera.

en: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
ny: Panthawi ya Nkhondo Yachiweruzo, mayiko khumi ndi atatu adayamba kupanga boma lofooka - pomwe Congress inali gawo lake lokha - pansi pa Articles of Confederation.

en: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
ny: Congress inalibe mphamvu zolipiritsa misonkho, ndipo, chifukwa kunalibe akuluakulu a dziko kapena oweruza milandu, idadalira akuluakulu a boma, omwe nthawi zambiri sankagwirizana, kuti azitsatira zochita zake zonse.

en: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
ny: Komanso inalibe ulamuliro wopondereza malamulo amisonkho ndi tariffs pakati pa mayiko.

en: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
ny: Nkhanizi zinkafuna chilolezo chogwirizana ndi mayiko onse zisanasinthidwe ndipo mayiko adatenga boma mopepuka kotero kuti oimira awo nthawi zambiri samakhalapo.

en: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
ny: Mpira wa dziko la Italy, pamodzi ndi timu ya mpira waku Germany ndi timu yachiwiri yopambana kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi ndipo anali akatswiri a FIFA World Cup mu 2006.

en: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
ny: Masewera otchuka amaphatikizapo mpira, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, kupalasa njinga, ice hockey, roller hockey ndi F1 motor racing.

en: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
ny: Masewera a Zima ndi otchuka kwambiri kumadera akumpoto, pomwe anthu aku Italiya amapikisana pamasewera apadziko lonse lapansi ndi zochitika za Olimpiki.

en: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
ny: Dziko la Japan lili ndi zilumba pafupifupi 7,000 (chachikulu kwambiri ndi Honshu), zomwe zimapangitsa Japan kukhala chilumba chachisanu ndi chiwiri padziko lonse lapansi!

en: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
ny: Chifukwa cha magulu / gulu la zilumba zomwe Japan ili nazo, Japan nthawi zambiri imatchulidwa, potengera malo, ngati "archipelago"

en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
ny: Taiwan idayamba kalekale m'zaka za m'ma 1500 pomwe amalinyero a ku Europe omwe amadutsa pachilumbachi amatcha Ilha Formosa, kapena chilumba chokongola.

en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
ny: Mu 1624, Dutch East India Company idakhazikitsa maziko kum'mwera chakumadzulo kwa Taiwan, ndikuyambitsa kusintha kwamachitidwe olima mbewu zachi Aboriginal ndikulemba antchito aku China kuti azigwira ntchito m'minda yake ya mpunga ndi shuga.

en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
ny: Mu 1683, asilikali a Qing Dynasty (1644-1912) adagonjetsa madera akumadzulo ndi kumpoto kwa Taiwan ndipo adalengeza kuti Taiwan ndi chigawo cha Qing Empire mu 1885.

en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
ny: Mu 1895, litagonjetsedwa pa Nkhondo Yoyamba ya Sino-Japan (1894-1895), boma la Qing linasaina Pangano la Shimonoseki, lomwe limapereka ulamuliro pa Taiwan ku Japan, lomwe likulamulira chilumbachi mpaka 1945.

en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
ny: Machu Picchu ali ndi nyumba zazikulu zitatu, zomwe ndi Intihuatana, Temple of the Sun, ndi Chipinda cha Mawindo Atatu.

en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
ny: Nyumba zambiri zomwe zili m'mphepete mwa nyumbayi zamangidwanso kuti zipatse alendo malingaliro abwino a momwe zidawonekera poyambirira.

en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
ny: Pofika 1976, makumi atatu pa zana a Machu Picchu anali atabwezeretsedwa ndipo kukonzanso kukupitilira mpaka lero.

en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, mawonekedwe odziwika kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi ojambulira zithunzi ndi 35mm, yomwe inali filimu yayikulu kwambiri kumapeto kwa nthawi ya filimu ya analogi.

en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
ny: Imapangidwabe lero, koma chofunikira kwambiri chiŵerengero chake chakhala chotengera mawonekedwe azithunzi za kamera ya digito.

en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
ny: Mtundu wa 35mm kwenikweni, wosokoneza, 36mm m'lifupi ndi 24mm kutalika.

en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
ny: Chiyerekezo cha mawonekedwe amtunduwu (kugawa ndi khumi ndi awiri kuti mupeze chiŵerengero chosavuta cha chiwerengero chonse) motero akuti ndi 3:2.

en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
ny: Mitundu yambiri yodziwika bwino (mawonekedwe amtundu wa APS, mwachitsanzo) ndi ofanana kapena pafupifupi pafupifupi gawoli.

en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
ny: Lamulo lozunzidwa kwambiri komanso lonyozedwa nthawi zambiri la magawo atatu ndi chitsogozo chosavuta chopanga mphamvu ndikusunga dongosolo mu chithunzi.

en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
ny: Ikunena kuti malo ogwira mtima kwambiri pamutu waukulu ndi pamzere wa mizere yogawa chithunzicho kukhala magawo atatu molunjika komanso mopingasa (onani chitsanzo).

en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
ny: M’nthaŵi imeneyi ya mbiri ya ku Ulaya, Tchalitchi cha Katolika, chimene chinalemera ndi champhamvu, chinayang’aniridwa.

en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
ny: Kwa zaka zoposa 1,000 chipembedzo chachikristu chinagwirizanitsa mayiko a ku Ulaya ngakhale kuti zinenero ndi miyambo zinali zosiyana. Ine

en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
ny: Mphamvu zake zonse zinakhudza aliyense kuyambira mfumu mpaka munthu wamba.

en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
ny: Chimodzi mwa mfundo zazikuluzikulu zachikhristu ndi chakuti chuma chiyenera kugwiritsidwa ntchito kuthetsa mavuto ndi umphawi komanso kuti ndalama za tchalitchi zilipo chifukwa chake.

en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
ny: Ulamuliro waukulu wa tchalitchi unali ku Roma kwa zaka zoposa 1,000 ndipo kuchulukana kwa mphamvu ndi ndalama kumeneku kunachititsa ambiri kukayikira ngati mfundo imeneyi ikukwaniritsidwa.

en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
ny: Nkhondo itangoyamba, dziko la Britain linayambitsa kutsekereza asilikali a pamadzi ku Germany.

en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
ny: Njirayi idakhala yothandiza, ndikuchepetsa zida zofunika zankhondo ndi anthu wamba, ngakhale kuti kutsekerezaku kunkaphwanya malamulo ovomerezeka omwe amavomerezedwa ndi mayiko angapo azaka mazana awiri apitawa.

en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
ny: Dziko la Britain linakumba madzi a m’mayiko osiyanasiyana pofuna kuletsa zombo zilizonse kulowa m’mbali zonse za nyanja, zomwe zinachititsa kuti ngakhale zombo zosalowerera ndale ziwonongeke.

en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ny: Popeza panali kulabadira kochepa ku njira imeneyi, Germany anayembekezera kulabadira kofananako kunkhondo zake zopanda malire zankhondo zapamadzi.

en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
ny: M’zaka za m’ma 1920, maganizo ofala a nzika ndi mayiko ambiri anali a pacifism ndi kudzipatula.

en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
ny: Pambuyo pakuwona zoopsa ndi nkhanza za nkhondo m’kati mwa Nkhondo Yadziko I, maiko anafuna kupeŵa mkhalidwe woteronso m’tsogolo.

en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
ny: Mu 1884, Tesla anasamukira ku United States of America kuti akagwire ntchito ku kampani ya Edison ku New York City.

en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
ny: Anafika ku US ali ndi masenti 4 ku dzina lake, buku la ndakatulo, ndi kalata yoyamikira kuchokera kwa Charles Batchelor (manejala wake pantchito yake yam'mbuyo) kwa Thomas Edison.

en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
ny: China yakale inali ndi njira yapadera yowonetsera nthawi zosiyanasiyana; gawo lililonse la China kapena banja lililonse lomwe linali ndi mphamvu linali mzera wosiyana.

en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
ny: Komanso pakati pa mzera uliwonse panali zaka zosakhazikika za zigawo zogawanika. Nthawi yodziwika bwino mwa nthawi izi inali nthawi ya Maufumu Atatu yomwe inachitika kwa zaka 60 pakati pa Mzera wa Han ndi Jin.

en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
ny: M’nthaŵi zimenezi kunkachitika nkhondo yoopsa pakati pa olemekezeka ambiri akumenyera mpando wachifumu.

en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
ny: Maufumu Atatu anali amodzi mwa nthawi zokhetsa magazi kwambiri m'mbiri yakale yaku China anthu masauzande ambiri adamwalira akumenyera nkhondo kuti akhale pampando wapamwamba kwambiri m'nyumba yachifumu ku Xi'an.

en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
ny: Pali zambiri zokhudzana ndi chikhalidwe ndi ndale monga kugwiritsa ntchito ma metric system, kusintha kuchoka ku absolutism kupita ku republicanism, nationalism ndi chikhulupiriro chakuti dziko ndi la anthu osati kwa wolamulira mmodzi yekha.

en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
ny: Komanso pambuyo pa ntchito za Revolution zinali zotsegukira kwa onse ofunsira amuna kulola ofunitsitsa komanso opambana kuti apambane.

en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
ny: Zomwezo zimapitanso kwa asitikali chifukwa m'malo mwa masanjidwe ankhondo potengera kalasi tsopano zidakhazikitsidwa pa cailaber.

en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
ny: Kuukira boma ku France kudalimbikitsanso anthu ena ambiri oponderezedwa a m'mayiko ena kuti ayambe kuwukira kwawo.

en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
ny: Muhamadi anali ndi chidwi kwambiri ndi zinthu zina zopitirira moyo wamba. Ankakonda kupita kuphanga lomwe limadziwika kuti "Hira" paphiri la "Noor" (kuwala) kuti alingalire.

en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
ny: iye phanga lokha, amene anapulumuka nthawi, amapereka chifaniziro choonekera bwino za uzimu wa Muhamadi.

en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
ny: Likupumula pamwamba pa limodzi la mapiri kumpoto kwa Mecca, phangalo lili kutali kwambiri ndi dziko lonse lapansi.

en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
ny: Ndipotu, n’kovuta kulipeza ngakhale munthu atadziwa kuti lilipo. Ukalowa m'phanga, ndi kudzipatula kotheratu.

en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ny: Palibe chimene chingawonedwe kupatula thambo loyera, lokongola pamwamba ndi mapiri ambiri ozungulira. Zochepa kwambiri za dziko lino zimatha kuwonedwa kapena kumva kuchokera mkati mwa mphanga.

en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
ny: Piramidi Yaikulu ku Giza ndi imodzi yokha mwa zodabwitsa zisanu ndi ziwiri zomwe zidakalipo lero.

en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
ny: Piramidiyo inamangidwa ndi Aiguputo m’zaka za m’ma 200 B.C.E.

en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
ny: Giza Plateau, kapena "Giza Necropolis" mu Chigwa cha Aigupto cha Akufa ali ndi mapiramidi angapo (omwe piramidi yaikulu ndi yaikulu), manda ang'onoang'ono angapo, akachisi angapo, ndi Sphinx yaikulu.

en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ny: Piramidi yayikulu idapangidwa kuti ilemekeze Farao Khufu, ndipo mapiramidi ang'onoang'ono, manda, ndi akachisi adamangidwa kuti azilemekeza akazi a Khufu ndi achibale ake.

en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
ny: Chizindikiro cha "uta mmwamba" chimawoneka ngati V ndi "chizindikiro cha uta" ngati chokhazikika kapena sikweya yomwe ikusowa pansi.

en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
ny: Mmwamba kumatanthauza kuti muyenera kuyambira pansonga ndikukankhira uta, ndipo pansi zikutanthauza kuti muyenera kuyamba pa chule (komwe ndi pamene dzanja lanu lagwira uta) ndi kukoka uta.

en: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
ny: Uta wa mmwamba nthawi zambiri umatulutsa mawu ocheperako, pomwe uta wapansi umakhala wamphamvu komanso wolimbikira.

en: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
ny: Khalani omasuka kulemba pensulo muzolemba zanu, koma kumbukirani kuti zopindika zosindikizidwa zilipo chifukwa cha nyimbo, kotero ziyenera kulemekezedwa.

en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
ny: Mfumu Louis XVI yowopsya, Mfumukazi Marie Antoinette ana awo aang'ono awiri (Marie Therese wazaka 11 ndi Louis-Charles wazaka zinayi) ndi mlongo wa Mfumu, Madam Elizabeth, pa 6 October 1789 anakakamizika kubwerera ku Paris kuchokera ku Versailles ndi gulu la anthu. akazi amsika.

en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
ny: Ali m’galeta, iwo anabwerera ku Paris atazunguliridwa ndi gulu la anthu akukuwa ndi kuopseza Mfumu ndi Mfumukazi.

en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
ny: Gulu la anthu linakakamiza Mfumu ndi Mfumukazi kuti atsegule mazenera onyamula katundu wawo.

en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
ny: Panthawi ina membala wa gululo anagwedeza mutu wa mlonda wachifumu yemwe anaphedwa ku Versailles pamaso pa Mfumukazi yowopsya.

en: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
ny: Ndalama zankhondo za imperialism ya US pakugonjetsa Philippines zidalipiridwa ndi anthu aku Philippines omwe.

en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
ny: Iwo anakakamizika kupereka misonkho ku ulamuliro wa atsamunda wa ku United States kuti awononge mbali yaikulu ya ndalama zomwe anawononga ndipo chiwongola dzanja cha bondi chinayandama m’dzina la boma la Philippines kudzera m’nyumba zamabanki ku Wall Street.

en: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
ny: Zoonadi, phindu lalikulu lochokera ku kudyetsedwa kwa nthawi yaitali kwa anthu a ku Philippines lingakhale zopindulitsa za imperialism ya US.

en: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
ny: Kuti timvetsetse Templars munthu ayenera kumvetsetsa nkhani yomwe idayambitsa kukhazikitsidwa kwa dongosolo.

en: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
ny: Nthawi yomwe zochitikazo zidachitika nthawi zambiri zimatchedwa High Middle Ages nthawi ya mbiri yaku Europe m'zaka za 11th, 12th, ndi 13th (AD 1000-1300).

en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
ny: Nyengo Zam'ma Middle Ages zidatsogoledwa ndi Zakale Zapakati ndipo zidatsatiridwa ndi Late Middle Ages, zomwe ndi msonkhano zimatha pafupifupi 1500.

en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
ny: Kutsimikiza kwaukadaulo ndi liwu lomwe limaphatikizapo malingaliro osiyanasiyana pochita, kuchokera kuukadaulo-kukankhira kapena kufunikira kwaukadaulo mpaka kutsimikiza kuti tsogolo la munthu limayendetsedwa ndi malingaliro okhudzana ndi malamulo asayansi ndikuwonekera kwawo muukadaulo.

en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
ny: Kutanthauzira kochuluka kwaukadaulo waukadaulo kumagawana malingaliro awiri: kuti chitukuko chaukadaulo chokha chimatsata njira yopitilira chikhalidwe kapena ndale, komanso kuti ukadaulo umakhala ndi "zotsatira" pamagulu omwe ali obadwa nawo, m'malo motengera chikhalidwe cha anthu.

en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, wina anganene kuti galimotoyo imatsogolera ku chitukuko cha misewu.

en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
ny: Komabe, misewu yapadziko lonse lapansi siipindulitsa pazachuma pa magalimoto owerengeka chabe, motero njira zatsopano zopangira zimapangidwira kuchepetsa mtengo wa umwini wagalimoto.

en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
ny: Kukhala ndi magalimoto ambiri kumapangitsanso kuti pakhale ngozi zambiri m'misewu, zomwe zimapangitsa kuti pakhale njira zatsopano zothandizira zaumoyo pokonza matupi owonongeka.

en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
ny: Chikondi chinali ndi gawo lalikulu la chikhalidwe cha chikhalidwe, chochokera kwa olemba monga Goethe, Fichte, ndi Schlegel.

en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
ny: Pankhani ya Romanticism, malo adaumba anthu, ndipo m'kupita kwa nthawi miyambo ndi chikhalidwe chokhudzana ndi malowo zinayamba, ndipo izi, pokhala zogwirizana ndi malo a anthu, zinali zabwino kuposa malamulo operekedwa mosasamala.

en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
ny: Momwe Paris imadziwika kuti likulu la mafashoni padziko lonse lapansi, Constantinople idawonedwa ngati likulu la mafashoni a feudal Europe.

en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
ny: Mbiri yake yokhala pachimake cha zinthu zapamwamba inayamba cha m’ma 400 AD ndipo inatha mpaka cha m’ma 1100 AD.

en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
ny: Mkhalidwe wake unatsika m’zaka za zana lakhumi ndi ziŵiri makamaka chifukwa chakuti Ankhondo a Mtanda anali atabwerako atanyamula mphatso zonga silika ndi zokometsera zomwe zinali zamtengo wapatali kuposa zimene misika ya Byzantine inkapereka.

en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
ny: Inali nthawi imeneyi kuti kusamutsidwa kwa mutu wa Fashion Capital kuchokera ku Constantinople kupita ku Paris.

en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
ny: Mtundu wa Gothic udafika pachimake pakati pa zaka za 10 - 11th ndi 14th century.

en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
ny: Pachiyambi chovalacho chinakhudzidwa kwambiri ndi chikhalidwe cha Byzantine kummawa.

en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
ny: Komabe, chifukwa cha njira zolankhulirana pang'onopang'ono, masitayelo akumadzulo amatha kutsalira zaka 25 mpaka 30.

en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ny: chakumapeto kwa Middle Ages kumadzulo kwa Europe adayamba kupanga mawonekedwe awoawo. chimodzi mwazinthu zazikulu zomwe zidachitika panthawiyo chifukwa cha nkhondo zamtanda anthu adayamba kugwiritsa ntchito mabatani kuti amange zovala.

en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
ny: Ulimi wapang'onopang'ono ndi ulimi womwe umapangidwa kuti apange chakudya chokwanira kuti akwaniritse zosowa za mlimi ndi banja lake.

en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
ny: Ulimi wang'onoang'ono ndi njira yosavuta, yomwe nthawi zambiri imagwiritsa ntchito mbewu zosungidwa kudera la ecoregion kuphatikiza ndi kasinthasintha wa mbewu kapena njira zina zosavuta zopezera zokolola.

en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
ny: M’mbuyomu alimi ambiri ankachita ulimi wamba ndipo izi zidakali choncho m’mayiko ambiri omwe akutukuka kumene.

en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
ny: Ma subcultures amasonkhanitsa anthu amalingaliro ofanana omwe amadzimva kuti anyalanyazidwa ndi miyezo ya chikhalidwe cha anthu ndipo amawalola kukulitsa chidziwitso.

en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
ny: Ma subcultures amatha kukhala osiyana chifukwa cha zaka, fuko, kalasi, malo, ndi / kapena jenda la mamembala.

en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
ny: Makhalidwe omwe amachititsa kuti chikhalidwe chamtundu wina chikhale chosiyana chingakhale chinenero, kukongola, chipembedzo, ndale, kugonana, malo, kapena zinthu zosiyanasiyana.

en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
ny: Mamembala a subculture nthawi zambiri amawonetsa umembala wawo pogwiritsa ntchito kalembedwe kosiyana komanso kophiphiritsa, komwe kumaphatikizapo mafashoni, machitidwe, ndi malingaliro.

en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
ny: Imodzi mwa njira zodziwika bwino zomwe zimagwiritsidwa ntchito posonyeza kufunikira kwa chikhalidwe cha anthu ndikutengera zochitika zochepa zatsoka za ana omwe, chifukwa cha kunyalanyaza, tsoka, kapena kuzunzidwa mwadala, osayanjana ndi akuluakulu pamene akukula.

en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
ny: Ana oterewa amatchedwa "feral" kapena zakutchire. Ana ena akutchire atsekeredwa ndi anthu (kaŵirikaŵiri makolo awo); nthawi zina kusiyidwa kwa mwana kumeneku kunali chifukwa cha kukana kwa makolo kufooka kwa luntha la mwana kwambiri kapena thupi.

en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
ny: Ana achiwerewere angakhale anazunzidwa kwambiri kapena kupwetekedwa mtima asanasiyidwe kapena kuthawa.

en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
ny: Ena akuti analeredwa ndi nyama; ena akuti ankakhala kutchire okha.

en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
ny: Akaleredwa kotheratu ndi nyama zomwe si anthu, mwana wamtchire amawonetsa machitidwe (mkati mwa malire a thupi) pafupifupi ngati a nyama zosamalira, monga kuopa kapena kusasamala kwa anthu.

en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
ny: Ngakhale kuphunzira kochokera ku polojekiti kuyenera kupangitsa kuphunzira kukhala kosavuta komanso kosangalatsa, kuchita masewera olimbitsa thupi kumapita patsogolo.

en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
ny: Scaffolding si njira yophunzirira koma ndi chithandizo chomwe chimapereka chithandizo kwa anthu omwe akuphunzira zatsopano monga kugwiritsa ntchito pulogalamu yatsopano yapakompyuta kapena kuyambitsa ntchito yatsopano.

en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
ny: Ma scaffolds amatha kukhala enieni komanso enieni, mwa kuyankhula kwina, mphunzitsi ndi mtundu wa scaffold koma momwemonso ndi munthu wamng'ono wa paperclip mu Microsoft Office.

en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
ny: Ma Virtual Scaffolds amalowetsedwa mkati mwa pulogalamuyo ndipo amapangidwira kufunsa, kufulumira, ndi kufotokozera njira zomwe zingakhale zovuta kuti wophunzira azigwira yekha.

en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
ny: Ana amatumizidwa ku Foster Care pazifukwa zosiyanasiyana, kuyambira kunyalanyazidwa, kuzunzidwa, ngakhalenso kulanda.

en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
ny: Palibe mwana amene ayenera kukulira m'malo opanda chisamaliro, chisamaliro, ndi maphunziro, koma amatero.

en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
ny: Timaona kuti Foster Care System ndi malo otetezeka kwa anawa.

en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
ny: Dongosolo lathu losamalira olera likuyenera kupereka nyumba zotetezeka, olera achikondi, maphunziro okhazikika, ndi chisamaliro chaumoyo chodalirika.

en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
ny: Olera akuyenera kupereka zofunikira zonse zomwe zinalibe m'nyumba zomwe adatengedwa kale.

en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
ny: Intaneti imaphatikiza zinthu zonse zolumikizana ndi anthu ambiri.

en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
ny: Makhalidwe apadera a intaneti amatsogolera ku miyeso yowonjezera malinga ndi momwe amagwiritsidwira ntchito komanso kukhutitsidwa.

en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
ny: Mwachitsanzo, "kuphunzira" ndi "kucheza" akufotokozedwa ngati zolimbikitsira pakugwiritsa ntchito intaneti (James et al., 1995).

en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
ny: "Kuchitapo kanthu pawekha" ndi "kupitilira maubale" adadziwikanso ngati zinthu zatsopano zolimbikitsa ndi Eighmey ndi McCord (1998) pomwe adafufuza momwe omvera amachitira pamasamba.

en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito kujambula kwamavidiyo kwapangitsa kuti pakhale zofunikira pakutanthauzira mawu ang'onoang'ono, mayendedwe amaso omwe amakhala ma milliseconds ochepa.

en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
ny: Makamaka, zimanenedwa kuti munthu amatha kuzindikira ngati munthu akunama potanthauzira mawu ang'onoang'ono molondola.

en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
ny: Oliver Sacks, m'nyuzipepala yake The President's Speech, adawonetsa momwe anthu omwe satha kumvetsetsa zolankhula chifukwa cha kuwonongeka kwa ubongo amatha kuyesa kuwona mtima molondola.

en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ny: Ananenanso kuti luso lotereli pomasulira khalidwe la munthu likhoza kukhala limodzi ndi nyama monga agalu apakhomo.

en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
ny: Kafukufuku wazaka za m'ma 20 adawonetsa kuti pali mitundu iwiri yamitundu yosiyanasiyana ya ma genetic: obisika komanso owonetsedwa.

en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
ny: Mutation imawonjezera kusintha kwa majini, ndipo kusankha kumachotsa pagulu la kusiyanasiyana komwe kumawonekera.

en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
ny: Kusiyanitsa ndi recombination kusintha kusiyana pakati pa maiwe awiri ndi m'badwo uliwonse.

en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
ny: Kunja ku savanna, ndizovuta kwa anyani omwe ali ndi dongosolo la m'mimba ngati la anthu kuti akwaniritse zofunikira zake za amino-acid kuchokera ku zomera zomwe zilipo.

en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
ny: Ndiponso, kulephera kutero kuli ndi zotulukapo zowopsa: kuvutika maganizo kwa kukula, kupereŵera kwa zakudya m’thupi, ndipo pamapeto pake imfa.

en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
ny: Zomera zomwe zinkapezeka mosavuta zikadakhala mapulotini opezeka m'masamba ndi nyemba, koma izi ndizovuta kuti anyani monga ife agayike pokhapokha ataphika.

en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
ny: Mosiyana ndi zimenezi, zakudya za nyama (nyerere, chiswe, mazira) sizimangosungunuka mosavuta, koma zimapereka mapuloteni ochuluka omwe ali ndi amino acid onse ofunikira.

en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
ny: Zonse zikaganiziridwa, sitiyenera kudabwa ngati makolo athu adathetsa "vuto la mapuloteni" awo mofanana ndi momwe anyani pa savanna amachitira lero.

en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
ny: Kusokoneza tulo ndi njira yodzuka mwadala panthawi yomwe mukugona komanso kugona pakapita nthawi (mphindi 10-60).

en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
ny: Izi zitha kuchitika mosavuta pogwiritsa ntchito wotchi yachete kuti muzindikire popanda kukudzutsani.

en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ny: Ngati mutapeza kuti mukukonzanso wotchiyo mu tulo, ikhoza kuikidwa mbali ina ya chipinda, ndikukukakamizani kuti mutuluke pabedi kuti muzimitse.

en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
ny: Njira zina zochokera ku biorhythm zimaphatikizapo kumwa madzi ambiri (makamaka madzi kapena tiyi, diuretic yodziwika bwino) asanagone, kukakamiza munthu kudzuka kuti akodza.

en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
ny: Kuchuluka kwa mtendere wamkati womwe munthu amakhala nawo kumagwirizana mosiyana ndi kuchuluka kwa mikangano mu thupi ndi mzimu.

en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
ny: Kuchepetsa kupsinjika, mphamvu ya moyo imakhala yabwino kwambiri. Munthu aliyense ali ndi kuthekera kopeza mtendere weniweni ndi chikhutiro.

en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
ny: Aliyense akhoza kupeza chidziwitso. Chinthu chokha chomwe chikuyima panjira ya cholinga ichi ndizovuta zathu komanso kusamvetsetsa kwathu.

en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
ny: Chibuddha cha Tibetan chimachokera ku ziphunzitso za Buddha, koma zidakulitsidwa ndi njira ya mahayana ya chikondi ndi njira zambiri zochokera ku Indian Yoga.

en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
ny: Kwenikweni Chibuddha cha Tibetan ndi chosavuta. Amakhala Kundalini Yoga, kusinkhasinkha ndi njira ya chikondi chonse.

en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
ny: Ndi Kundalini Yoga mphamvu ya Kundalini (mphamvu yowunikira) imadzutsidwa kudzera mumayendedwe a yoga, masewera olimbitsa thupi, mantras ndi zowonera.

en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
ny: Pakatikati pa kusinkhasinkha kwa Tibetan ndi Deity Yoga. Kupyolera mukuwona kwa milungu yosiyanasiyana njira zamagetsi zimatsukidwa, ma chakras amayatsidwa ndipo chidziwitso chowunikira chimapangidwa.

en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
ny: Germany inali mdani wamba pa Nkhondo Yadziko II, zomwe zidapangitsa mgwirizano pakati pa USSR ndi USA. Kumapeto kwa nkhondoyo mikangano ya machitidwe, ndondomeko ndi chikhalidwe zinapangitsa kuti mayiko awonongeke.

en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
ny: Ndi zaka ziŵiri za kutha kwa nkhondoyo, amene kale anali ogwirizana nawo tsopano anali adani ndipo Nkhondo ya Mawu inayamba.

en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ny: Iyenera kukhala kwa zaka 40 ndipo idzamenyedwa ndi zenizeni, ndi magulu ankhondo, pamabwalo ankhondo kuchokera ku Africa kupita ku Asia, ku Afghanistan, Cuba ndi malo ena ambiri.

en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
ny: Pofika pa Seputembara 17, 1939, chitetezo cha ku Poland chinali chitasweka kale, ndipo chiyembekezo chokha chinali chobwerera ndikukonzekeranso m'mphepete mwa mlatho wa ku Romania.

en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
ny: Komabe, mapulaniwa adachotsedwa ntchito pafupifupi usiku umodzi, pomwe asitikali opitilira 800,000 ochokera ku Soviet Union Red Army adalowa ndikupanga madera aku Belarus ndi Ukraine atalanda zigawo zakum'mawa kwa Poland mophwanya Pangano lamtendere la Riga, Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression. Pact, ndi mapangano ena apadziko lonse lapansi, onse awiri komanso mayiko ambiri.

en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito zombo zonyamula katundu ndiyo njira yabwino kwambiri yosamutsira anthu ndi katundu wambiri kudutsa nyanja zamchere.

en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
ny: Ntchito ya oyendetsa panyanja yakhala ikuwonetsetsa kuti dziko lanu limakhalabe ndi luso losuntha anthu ndi katundu wanu, panthawi imodzimodziyo, kusokoneza mphamvu ya mdani wanu kusuntha anthu ndi katundu wake.

en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zaposachedwa kwambiri za izi chinali kampeni ya North Atlantic ya WWII. Anthu aku America anali kuyesera kusamutsa amuna ndi zida kuwoloka nyanja ya Atlantic kuti athandize Britain.

en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
ny: Panthaŵi imodzimodziyo, asilikali apamadzi a ku Germany, pogwiritsa ntchito makamaka mabwato a U-, ankayesa kuletsa magalimoto amenewa.

en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
ny: Ngati Allies akanalephera, Germany mwina akanatha kugonjetsa Britain monga momwe zinalili ndi Ulaya yense.

en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
ny: Mbuzi zikuwoneka kuti zidayamba kuŵetedwa zaka 10,000 zapitazo kumapiri a Zagros ku Iran.

en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
ny: Zikhalidwe ndi mafuko akale anayamba kuwasunga kuti apeze mosavuta mkaka, tsitsi, nyama, ndi zikopa.

en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
ny: Nthawi zambiri mbuzi zoweta zinkawetedwa m’magulu amene ankangoyendayenda m’mapiri kapena m’malo ena odyetserako ziweto, ndipo nthawi zambiri ankawetedwa ndi abusa a mbuzi omwe nthawi zambiri anali ana kapena achinyamata, mofanana ndi m’busa wodziwika kwambiri. Njira zoweta zimenezi zikugwiritsidwabe ntchito mpaka pano.

en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
ny: Wagonways anamangidwa ku England koyambirira kwa zaka za zana la 16.

en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
ny: Ngakhale kuti ngolo zinkangokhala ndi matabwa oyendera limodzi, mahatchi ankawalola kuti azitha kuthamanga kwambiri komanso kukoka katundu wokulirapo kusiyana ndi m'misewu yovuta kwambiri yapanthaŵiyo.

en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
ny: Ma crossties adayambitsidwa koyambirira kuti njanji zikhazikike. Komabe, pang'onopang'ono, zinadziwika kuti njanji zikanakhala zogwira mtima kwambiri ngati zinali ndi chitsulo pamwamba.

en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
ny: Zimenezi zinafala kwambiri, koma chitsulocho chinachititsa kuti mawilo amatabwa a ngolozo awonongeke kwambiri.
