en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
ny: M’kupita kwa nthaŵi, mawilo amatabwa analoŵedwa m’malo ndi mawilo achitsulo. Mu 1767, njanji zoyamba zachitsulo zonse zinayambitsidwa.

en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
ny: Ulendo woyamba wodziwika unali kuyenda, anthu anayamba kuyenda mowongoka zaka 2 miliyoni zapitazo ndi kutuluka kwa Homo Erectus (kutanthauza munthu wowongoka).

en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
ny: Akale awo, Australopithecus sanayende mowongoka monga mwachizolowezi.

en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ny: Bipedal specializations amapezeka ku Australopithecus zakale za 4.2-3.9 miliyoni zapitazo, ngakhale Sahelanthropus mwina adayenda ndi miyendo iwiri koyambirira kwa zaka 7 miliyoni zapitazo.

en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
ny: Titha kuyamba kukhala ochezeka kwambiri ndi chilengedwe, titha kulowa nawo gulu lazachilengedwe, ndipo titha kukhala olimbikitsa kuti tichepetse kuvutika kwamtsogolo pamlingo wina.

en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
ny: Izi zimangokhala ngati chithandizo chazizindikiro nthawi zambiri. Komabe, ngati sitikufuna kuti tipeze yankho lakanthawi kochepa chabe, tiyenera kupeza gwero la mavutowo, ndipo tiyenera kuwaletsa.

en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
ny: N’zoonekeratu kuti dzikoli lasintha kwambiri chifukwa cha kupita patsogolo kwa anthu pa nkhani za sayansi ndi luso lazopangapanga, ndipo mavuto awonjezereka chifukwa cha kuchulukana kwa anthu ndiponso moyo wopambanitsa wa anthu.

en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
ny: Pambuyo pa kukhazikitsidwa ndi Congress pa Julayi 4, zolemba zolembedwa pamanja ndi Purezidenti wa Congress John Hancock ndi Secretary Charles Thomson ndiye zidatumizidwa midadada ingapo kupita kumalo osindikizira a John Dunlap.

en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
ny: Pakati pa usiku makope 150 ndi 200 anapangidwa, omwe tsopano amadziwika kuti "Dunlap broadsides".

en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
ny: Kuwerenga koyamba pagulu kwa chikalatacho kunali a John Nixon pabwalo la Independence Hall pa Julayi 8.

en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
ny: Limodzi linatumizidwa ku George Washington pa July 6, amene analiŵerenga kwa asilikali ake ku New York pa July 9. Buku lina linafika ku London pa August 10.

en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
ny: Masamba 25 a Dunlap omwe amadziwikabe kuti alipo ndi makope akale kwambiri a chikalatacho. Kope loyambirira lolembedwa pamanja silinakhalepo.

en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
ny: Akatswiri ambiri a mbiri yakale masiku ano amakhulupirira kuti gulu limodzi la madinosaur linapulumuka ndipo liliponso masiku ano. Timazitcha mbalame.

en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
ny: Anthu ambiri samawaona ngati madinosaur chifukwa ali ndi nthenga ndipo amatha kuwuluka.

en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
ny: Koma pali zinthu zambiri zokhudza mbalame zomwe zimaonekabe ngati dinosaur.

en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
ny: Ali ndi mapazi okhala ndi mamba ndi zikhadabo, amaikira mazira, ndipo amayenda ndi miyendo yawo iwiri yakumbuyo ngati T-Rex.

en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
ny: Pafupifupi makompyuta onse omwe akugwiritsidwa ntchito masiku ano amachokera ku kusintha kwa chidziwitso chomwe chimalembedwa mu mawonekedwe a manambala a binary.

en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
ny: Nambala ya binary ikhoza kukhala ndi chimodzi mwazinthu ziwiri, mwachitsanzo, 0 kapena 1, ndipo manambalawa amatchulidwa ngati manambala apawiri - kapena bits, kugwiritsa ntchito jargon ya pakompyuta.

en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
ny: Poizoni wamkati sangawonekere nthawi yomweyo. Zizindikiro, monga kusanza, ndizofala kwambiri moti sizingadziwike msanga.

en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
ny: Chizindikiro chabwino kwambiri cha poizoni wamkati chikhoza kukhala kukhalapo kwa chidebe chotseguka cha mankhwala kapena mankhwala owopsa apanyumba.

en: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ny: Yang'anani pa chizindikirocho kuti mupeze malangizo enieni a chithandizo choyamba cha chiphecho.

en: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
ny: Mawu akuti bug amagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi entomologists mwachidziwitso cha gulu ili la tizilombo.

en: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
ny: Mawuwa amachokera ku zomwe zidadziwika kale ndi nsikidzi, zomwe ndi tizilombo tomwe timatha kupha anthu.

en: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
ny: Onse a Assassin-bugs ndi Bed-bugs ndi opusa, amazolowera kukhala m'chisa kapena m'nyumba za omwe amawalandira.

en: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
ny: Kudera lonse la United States of America, pali pafupifupi 400,000 omwe amadziwika kuti ali ndi Multiple Sclerosis (MS), kuwasiya ngati matenda otsogolera amisala mwa achikulire achichepere ndi apakati.

en: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
ny: MS ndi matenda omwe amakhudza dongosolo lalikulu la mitsempha, lomwe limapangidwa ndi ubongo, msana ndi mitsempha ya optic.

en: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
ny: Kafukufuku wapeza kuti akazi ali ndi mwayi wowirikiza kawiri kukhala ndi MS kuposa amuna.

en: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
ny: Okwatirana angasankhe kuti kulera khanda sikuli kwabwino kwa iwo, kapenanso kwa mwana wawo.

en: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
ny: Mabanjawa akhoza kusankha kupanga ndondomeko yolera ana awo.

en: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
ny: M’kulera ana olera anawo, makolo obadwawo amathetsa ufulu wawo wa makolo kotero kuti mwamuna ndi mkazi wina athe kulera mwanayo.

en: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
ny: Cholinga chachikulu cha sayansi ndikuzindikira momwe dziko limagwirira ntchito kudzera munjira yasayansi. Njirayi imatsogolera kafukufuku wambiri wasayansi.

en: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
ny: Sizokhazokha, kuyesa, ndi kuyesa ndi kuyesa komwe kumagwiritsidwa ntchito kuthetsa chimodzi kapena zingapo zomwe zingatheke, kufunsa mafunso, ndi kupanga zowunikira zimatsogoleranso kafukufuku wa sayansi.

en: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
ny: Akatswiri a zachilengedwe ndi afilosofi anaika maganizo awo pa malemba akale, makamaka Baibulo la Chilatini.

en: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
ny: Anavomereza maganizo a Aristotle pankhani zonse za sayansi, kuphatikizapo maganizo.

en: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
ny: Pamene chidziŵitso cha Chigiriki chinacheperachepera, Azungu anadzipeza kukhala opanda maziko ake a nthanthi Zachigiriki ndi zasayansi.

en: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
ny: Ambiri omwe amawona ma physiology ndi machitidwe nthawi zambiri amadalira kukhalapo kwa zozungulira zamkati komanso kupanga kwawo kudzera mu mawotchi achilengedwe.

en: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
ny: Mipangidwe yanthawi ndi nthawi, yomwe simayankhidwe chabe ku zochitika zakunja, zalembedwa kwa zamoyo zambiri, kuphatikizapo mabakiteriya, bowa, zomera, ndi zinyama.

en: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
ny: Mawotchi achilengedwe ndi ma oscillator odzithandizira okha omwe amapitilira nthawi yothamanga panjinga ngakhale palibe zizindikiro zakunja.

en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
ny: Kuyesera kwa Hershey ndi Chase kunali imodzi mwa malingaliro otsogolera kuti DNA inali chibadwa.

en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
ny: Hershey ndi Chase amagwiritsa ntchito phages, kapena mavairasi, kuti aike DNA yawo mu bakiteriya.

en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
ny: Iwo adayesa kawiri ndikulemba DNA mu phage ndi phosphorous yotulutsa radioactive kapena puloteni ya phage yokhala ndi sulfure wa radioactive.

en: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
ny: Kusintha kumatha kukhala ndi zotsatira zosiyanasiyana kutengera mtundu wa masinthidwe, kufunikira kwa gawo la ma genetic omwe akhudzidwa komanso ngati maselo omwe akhudzidwa ndi maselo amtundu wa majeremusi.

en: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
ny: Kusintha kokha m'maselo a majeremusi kungapatsire ana, pamene kusintha kwina kungayambitse imfa ya maselo kapena khansa.

en: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
ny: Zoyendera zachilengedwe zimakopa anthu omwe ali ndi chidwi choyendera malo achilengedwe ndi cholinga chosangalala ndi malo, kuphatikiza zomera ndi nyama zakuthengo.

en: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
ny: Zitsanzo za zochitika zapamalopo ndi monga kusaka, kusodza, kujambula zithunzi, kuonera mbalame, ndi kuyendera mapaki ndi kuphunzira zambiri za chilengedwe.

en: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
ny: Chitsanzo ndi kuyendera, kujambula zithunzi, ndi kuphunzira za organgatuangs ku Borneo.

en: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
ny: M’maŵa uliwonse, anthu amachoka m’matauni ang’onoang’ono m’magalimoto kupita kuntchito kwawo ndipo amadutsidwa ndi ena amene ntchito yawo ndi kumene angochokako.

en: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
ny: Mu shuttle yosunthika iyi aliyense amalumikizidwa mwanjira ina, ndikuthandizira, mayendedwe otengera magalimoto apayekha.

en: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
ny: Sayansi tsopano ikuwonetsa kuti chuma chochuluka cha carbon ichi chachotsa chilengedwe kuchokera kumodzi mwa mayiko ake okhazikika omwe athandizira kusintha kwa anthu kwa zaka mamiliyoni awiri apitawa.

en: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
ny: Aliyense amatenga nawo mbali pagulu ndipo amagwiritsa ntchito njira zamayendedwe. Pafupifupi aliyense amadandaula za kayendedwe ka kayendedwe.

en: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
ny: M'mayiko otukuka simumva madandaulo ngati amenewa okhudza ubwino wa madzi kapena kuti milatho ikugwa.

en: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ny: N’chifukwa chiyani kayendedwe ka kayendedwe kamayambitsa madandaulo otere, n’chifukwa chiyani amalephera tsiku ndi tsiku? Kodi mainjiniya oyendetsa mayendedwe alibe luso? Kapena pali chinthu china chofunika kwambiri chimene chikuchitika?

en: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
ny: Mayendedwe a Magalimoto ndi kafukufuku wa kayendedwe ka madalaivala pawokha ndi magalimoto pakati pa nsonga ziwiri ndi kulumikizana komwe amapanga wina ndi mnzake.

en: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
ny: Tsoka ilo, kuphunzira kayendedwe ka magalimoto ndikovuta chifukwa machitidwe oyendetsa sanganenedwe motsimikiza zana limodzi pa zana.

en: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
ny: Mwamwayi, madalaivala amakonda kuchita zinthu mosasinthasintha; motero, mitsinje yamagalimoto imakhala ndi kusinthasintha koyenera ndipo imatha kuimiridwa mwamasamu.

en: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
ny: Pofuna kuyimira bwino kayendedwe ka magalimoto, maubwenzi akhazikitsidwa pakati pa mikhalidwe itatu ikuluikulu: (1) kuyenda, (2) kachulukidwe, ndi (3) liwiro.

en: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
ny: Maubwenzi awa amathandizira kupanga, kupanga, ndi magwiridwe antchito amisewu.

en: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
ny: Tizilombo tinali nyama zoyamba kupita kumlengalenga. Kukhoza kwawo kuuluka kunawathandiza kupeŵa adani mosavuta ndikupeza chakudya ndi zibwenzi bwinobwino.

en: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
ny: Tizilombo tambiri timakhala ndi mwayi wokhoza kupinda mapiko awo kumbuyo kwa thupi.

en: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
ny: Izi zimawapatsa malo ang'onoang'ono osiyanasiyana kuti abisale kwa adani.

en: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
ny: Masiku ano, tizilombo tomwe sitingathe kupinda mmbuyo mapiko awo ndi ntchentche za chinjoka ndi mayflies.

en: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
ny: Zaka masauzande angapo zapitazo, munthu wina dzina lake Aristarko ananena kuti Dzuwa limayenda mozungulira Dzuwa.

en: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
ny: Anthu ena ankaganiza kuti iye anali wolondola koma anthu ambiri anakhulupirira zosiyana; kuti Dzuwa limayenda mozungulira Dziko Lapansi, kuphatikizapo Dzuwa (komanso nyenyezi zina).

en: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
ny: Izi zikuwoneka zomveka, chifukwa Dziko lapansi silimamva ngati likuyenda, sichoncho?

en: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
ny: Mtsinje wa Amazon ndi wachiwiri wautali kwambiri komanso mtsinje waukulu kwambiri padziko lapansi. Amanyamula madzi ochuluka kuwirikiza ka 8 kuposa mtsinje waukulu wachiwiri.

en: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
ny: Mtsinje wa Amazon ndiwonso mtsinje waukulu kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi, nthawi zina m'lifupi makilomita asanu.

en: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
ny: Madzi 20 pa 100 alionse amene amathira m’mitsinje ya padzikoli n’kupita m’nyanja zikuluzikulu amachokera ku Amazon.

en: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ny: Mtsinje waukulu wa Amazon ndi 6,387 km (3,980 miles). Imasonkhanitsa madzi kuchokera ku mitsinje yaing'ono masauzande.

en: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
ny: Ngakhale kumanga piramidi pamiyala kunapitilira mpaka kumapeto kwa Ufumu Wakale, mapiramidi a Giza sanapitirire kukula kwake komanso luso lawo lomanga.

en: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
ny: Ufumu Watsopano Aigupto akale anachita chidwi ndi zipilala zimene zinayambikapo, zomwe panthaŵiyo zinali ndi zaka zoposa chikwi chimodzi.

en: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
ny: Mzinda wa Vatican uli ndi anthu pafupifupi 800. Ndilo dziko laling'ono kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi komanso dziko lomwe lili ndi anthu ochepa kwambiri.

en: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
ny: Vatican City imagwiritsa ntchito Chitaliyana pamalamulo ake komanso mauthenga ovomerezeka.

en: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
ny: Chiitaliyanso ndi chilankhulo cha tsiku ndi tsiku chomwe anthu ambiri omwe amagwira ntchito m'boma amagwiritsa ntchito Chilatini nthawi zambiri pamiyambo yachipembedzo.

en: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ny: Nzika zonse za Vatican City ndi Roman Catholic.

en: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
ny: Anthu akhala akudziwa za zinthu zofunika kwambiri za mankhwala monga golidi, siliva, ndi mkuwa kuyambira kalekale, chifukwa zonsezi zimatha kupezeka m’chilengedwe m’maonekedwe awo ndipo n’zosavuta kuzikumba ndi zida zakale.

en: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
ny: Wafilosofi wina, Aristotle, ananena kuti chilichonse chimapangidwa ndi chisakanizo cha chinthu chimodzi kapena zingapo mwa zinthu zinayi. Anali dziko lapansi, madzi, mpweya, ndi moto.

en: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
ny: Izi zinali ngati zigawo zinayi za zinthu (mu dongosolo lomwelo): zolimba, zamadzimadzi, mpweya, ndi madzi a m’magazi, ngakhale ananenanso kuti zimasintha n’kukhala zinthu zatsopano n’kupanga zimene timaona.

en: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
ny: Aloyi kwenikweni ndi osakaniza awiri kapena kuposa zitsulo. Musaiwale kuti pali zinthu zambiri pa tebulo la periodic.

en: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
ny: Zinthu monga calcium ndi potaziyamu zimatengedwa ngati zitsulo. Inde, palinso zitsulo monga siliva ndi golidi.

en: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
ny: Mukhozanso kukhala ndi ma alloys omwe amaphatikizapo zinthu zazing'ono zopanda zitsulo monga carbon.

en: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
ny: Chilichonse m'Chilengedwe chimapangidwa ndi zinthu. Zinthu zonse zimapangidwa ndi tinthu ting'onoting'ono totchedwa maatomu.

en: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
ny: Maatomu ndi ang'onoang'ono kwambiri kotero kuti ma thililiyoni angagwirizane ndi nthawi yomwe ili kumapeto kwa chiganizochi.

en: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
ny: Motero, pensuloyo inali bwenzi lapamtima la anthu ambiri pamene idatuluka.

en: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
ny: Chomvetsa chisoni n’chakuti, pamene njira zatsopano zolembera zatulukira, pensuloyo yakhala yocheperapo ndi kugwiritsidwa ntchito kwake.

en: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
ny: Anthu tsopano amalemba mauthenga pamakompyuta, osafunikira kuyandikira pafupi ndi chowongolera.

en: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
ny: Munthu akhoza kungodabwa kuti kiyibodi idzakhala chiyani pamene china chatsopano chibwera.

en: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
ny: Bomba la fission limagwira ntchito pa mfundo yakuti pamafunika mphamvu kuti akhazikitse nyukiliyasi yokhala ndi ma protoni ambiri ndi ma neutroni.

en: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
ny: Zili ngati kugudubuza ngolo yolemera kukwera phiri. Kugawanitsa phata kachiwiri kenaka kumatulutsa zina mwa mphamvuzo.

en: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
ny: Ma atomu ena amakhala ndi ma nuclei osakhazikika kutanthauza kuti amakonda kupatukana ndikugwedezeka pang'ono kapena osasunthika.

en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
ny: Pamwamba pa Mwezi ndi miyala ndi fumbi. Mbali yakunja ya Mwezi imatchedwa kutumphuka.

en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
ny: Kutalika kwake ndi pafupifupi 70 km kukhuthala mbali yapafupi ndi 100 km kukhuthala mbali yakutali.

en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
ny: Ndiwoonda pansi pa maria ndipo ndi wokhuthala pansi pa mapiri.

en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
ny: Pakhoza kukhala maria ambiri kumbali yapafupi chifukwa kutumphuka kumakhala kocheperako. Zinali zosavuta kuti chiphalaphala chikwere pamwamba.

en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
ny: Ziphunzitso za zomwe zili mkati zimakhazikika pakupeza zomwe zimapangitsa anthu kuti azikonda kapena kuwakonda.

en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
ny: Mfundozi zikusonyeza kuti anthu ali ndi zosowa zina ndi/kapena zilakolako zomwe zakhala zikugwiritsidwa ntchito pamene akukula mpaka kukula.

en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
ny: Mfundozi zimayang’ana zimene zili zokhudza anthu ena zimene zimawapangitsa kufuna zinthu zimene amachita komanso zimene zili m’dera lawo zimene zingawapangitse kuchita kapena kusachita zinthu zina.

en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ny: Mfundo ziwiri zodziwika bwino ndi Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory ndi Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
ny: Nthawi zambiri, machitidwe awiri amatha kuwonekera pomwe oyang'anira ayamba kutsogolera anzawo akale. Mapeto amodzi a masewerowa akuyesera kukhalabe "m'modzi mwa anyamata" (kapena gals).

en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
ny: Oyang'anira wamtunduwu amavutika kupanga zisankho zomwe sizingawasangalatse, kulanga, kuwunika momwe kagwiridwe ntchito, kupereka udindo, ndi kuyankha anthu mlandu.

en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
ny: Kumapeto ena a sipekitiramu, morphs imodzi imakhala munthu wosadziwika yemwe amamva kuti ayenera kusintha zonse zomwe gulu lakhala likuchita ndikudzipanga kukhala lawo.

en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
ny: Pambuyo pake, mtsogoleri ndiye pomalizira pake ndiye amachititsa kupambana ndi kulephera kwa gululo.

en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
ny: Khalidweli nthawi zambiri limabweretsa mikangano pakati pa atsogoleri ndi gulu lonse.

en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
ny: Magulu owoneka bwino amagwiridwa pamiyezo yofanana yakuchita bwino ngati magulu wamba, koma pali kusiyana kobisika.

en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
ny: Mamembala a gulu la Virtual nthawi zambiri amagwira ntchito ngati malo olumikizirana ndi gulu lawo lakuthupi.

en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
ny: Nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi ufulu wodziyimira pawokha kuposa mamembala wamba popeza magulu awo amatha kukumana molingana ndi nthawi zosiyanasiyana zomwe sangamvetsetsedwe ndi oyang'anira kwawo.

en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
ny: Kukhalapo kwa "gulu losaoneka" lenileni (Larson ndi LaFasto, 1989, p109) ndi gawo lapadera la gulu lenileni.

en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
ny: "Gulu losaoneka" ndi gulu loyang'anira lomwe aliyense wa mamembala amalipoti. Gulu losawoneka limakhazikitsa miyezo ya membala aliyense.

en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
ny: Chifukwa chiyani bungwe lingafune kudutsa njira yowonongera nthawi yokhazikitsa bungwe lophunzirira? Cholinga chimodzi chokhazikitsa mfundo zophunzirira za bungwe ndikuyambitsa zatsopano.

en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
ny: Pamene zinthu zonse zomwe zilipo zikugwiritsidwa ntchito moyenera m'madipatimenti onse ogwira ntchito a bungwe, luso ndi nzeru zimatha kuchitika.

en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
ny: Chotsatira chake, ndondomeko ya bungwe lomwe likugwira ntchito limodzi kuti ligonjetse chopinga chingabweretse njira yatsopano yopangira zosowa za kasitomala.

en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
ny: Bungwe lisanakhale lachidziwitso, utsogoleri uyenera kupanga chikhalidwe chatsopano komanso kugawana chidziwitso ndi maphunziro a bungwe.

en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
ny: Angel (2006), akufotokoza njira ya Continuum ngati njira yomwe imagwiritsidwa ntchito pothandizira mabungwe kuti akwaniritse ntchito zapamwamba.

en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
ny: Deta ya Neurobiological imapereka umboni wakuthupi wa njira yamalingaliro pakufufuza kwa kuzindikira. Chifukwa chake imachepetsa gawo lofufuzira ndikupangitsa kuti likhale lolondola kwambiri.

en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
ny: Kulumikizana pakati pa matenda aubongo ndi machitidwe kumathandizira asayansi pakufufuza kwawo.

en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
ny: Zakhala zikudziwika kwa nthawi yayitali kuti mitundu yosiyanasiyana ya kuwonongeka kwa ubongo, kuvulala, zotupa, ndi zotupa zimakhudza khalidwe ndipo zimayambitsa kusintha kwa ntchito zina zamaganizo.

en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
ny: Kukwera kwa matekinoloje atsopano kumatithandiza kuwona ndikufufuza momwe ubongo umapangidwira ndi njira zomwe sizinawonedwepo.

en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
ny: Izi zimatipatsa chidziwitso ndi zinthu zambiri zoti tipange zofananira zomwe zimatithandiza kumvetsetsa njira m'malingaliro athu.

en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
ny: Ngakhale AI ili ndi tanthauzo lolimba la zopeka za sayansi, AI imapanga nthambi yofunikira kwambiri ya sayansi yamakompyuta, yokhudzana ndi machitidwe, kuphunzira komanso kusintha mwanzeru pamakina.

en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
ny: Kafukufuku mu AI amakhudza kupanga makina kuti azisintha ntchito zomwe zimafuna kuchita mwanzeru.

en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
ny: Zitsanzo zikuphatikizapo kulamulira, kukonzekera ndi kukonza, kutha kuyankha zowawa za makasitomala ndi mafunso, komanso kuzindikira zolemba pamanja, mawu ndi nkhope.

en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
ny: Zinthu zotere zakhala miyambo yosiyana, yomwe imayang'ana pakupereka njira zothetsera mavuto enieni a moyo.

en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
ny: Dongosolo la AI tsopano limagwiritsidwa ntchito nthawi zambiri pankhani yazachuma, zamankhwala, uinjiniya ndi usilikali, monga momwe amapangidwira pamakompyuta angapo apakompyuta ndi mapulogalamu amasewera apakanema.

en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
ny: Maulendo akumunda ndi gawo lalikulu la kalasi iliyonse. Nthawi zambiri mphunzitsi angakonde kutengera ophunzira ake malo omwe ulendo wa basi sungakhalepo.

en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
ny: Tekinoloje imapereka yankho ndi maulendo apaulendo. Ophunzira amatha kuyang'ana zinthu zakale zosungiramo zinthu zakale, kupita kumalo osungiramo madzi am'madzi, kapena kusirira zaluso zokongola atakhala ndi kalasi yawo.

en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
ny: Kugawana ulendo wakumunda ndi njira yabwino kwambiri yowonera paulendo ndikugawana zokumana nazo ndi makalasi amtsogolo.

en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, chaka chilichonse ophunzira ochokera ku Bennet School ku North Carolina amapanga webusayiti yokhudzana ndi ulendo wawo wopita ku State Capital, chaka chilichonse tsambalo limakonzedwanso, koma matembenuzidwe akale amasungidwa pa intaneti kuti akhale ngati scrapbook.

en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
ny: Mabulogu angathandizenso kukonza zolemba za ophunzira. Ngakhale ophunzira nthawi zambiri amayamba zomwe amakumana nazo pamabulogu ndi malankhulidwe osasamala komanso kalembedwe, kupezeka kwa omvera nthawi zambiri kumasintha.

en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
ny: Popeza ophunzira nthawi zambiri amakhala omvera kwambiri, wolemba mabulogu amayamba kuyesetsa kukonza zolembera kuti apewe kutsutsidwa.

en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
ny: Komanso kulemba mabulogu "kukakamiza ophunzira kukhala odziwa zambiri za dziko lowazungulira." Kufunika kodyetsa chidwi cha omvera kumalimbikitsa ophunzira kukhala anzeru komanso osangalatsa (Toto, 2004).

en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
ny: Kulemba mabulogu ndi chida chomwe chimalimbikitsa mgwirizano, ndikulimbikitsa ophunzira kuti awonjezere kuphunzira kupyola nthawi yanthawi yasukulu.

en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito mabulogu moyenera "kutha kupatsa mphamvu ophunzira kuti azisanthula komanso kutsutsa; poyankha mwachangu kuzinthu zapaintaneti, ophunzira amatha kufotokozera malo awo malinga ndi zomwe ena adalemba komanso kufotokoza momwe amawonera pazinthu zina (Oravec, 2002).

en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
ny: Ottawa ndi likulu la Canada lokongola, lolankhula zilankhulo ziwiri ndipo lili ndi malo ambiri owonetsera zojambulajambula ndi malo osungiramo zinthu zakale omwe amawonetsa zakale ndi zamakono zaku Canada.

en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
ny: Kumwera chakumwera kuli mathithi a Niagara ndipo kumpoto kuli malo okongola a Muskoka ndi kupitirira apo.

en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
ny: Zinthu zonsezi ndi zina zambiri zikuwunikira Ontario monga zomwe zimawonedwa ngati zaku Canada ndi akunja.

en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
ny: Madera akuluakulu kumpoto kwenikweni ali ndi anthu ochepa ndipo ena ndi chipululu chopanda anthu.

en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
ny: Poyerekeza kuchuluka kwa anthu omwe amadabwitsa ambiri: Pali anthu ambiri aku Africa aku America omwe amakhala ku US kuposa omwe ali nzika zaku Canada.

en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
ny: Zilumba za East Africa zili m'nyanja ya Indian Ocean chakum'mawa kwa Africa.

en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
ny: Madagascar ndiye dziko lalikulu kwambiri, komanso kontinenti palokha pankhani ya nyama zakuthengo.

en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
ny: Zisumbu zing'onozing'ono zambiri ndi mayiko odziyimira pawokha, kapena ogwirizana ndi France, ndipo amadziwika kuti ndi malo ochezera a m'mphepete mwa nyanja.

en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
ny: Arabu adabweretsanso Chisilamu m'maiko, ndipo zidatenga gawo lalikulu ku Comoros ndi Mayotte.

en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
ny: Chikoka cha ku Ulaya ndi chitsamunda chinayamba m’zaka za zana la 15, pamene wofufuza malo wachipwitikizi Vasco da Gama anapeza njira ya Cape Route kuchokera ku Ulaya kupita ku India.

en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
ny: Kumpoto derali kumalire ndi Sahel, ndipo kumwera ndi kumadzulo ndi nyanja ya Atlantic.

en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
ny: Akazi: Ndikoyenera kuti akazi aliwonse apaulendo azinena kuti ali pabanja, mosasamala kanthu za mkhalidwe weniweni wa m’banja.

en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
ny: Ndizothandiza kuvalanso mphete (osati imodzi yomwe imawoneka yodula kwambiri.

en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
ny: Amayi akuyenera kuzindikira kuti kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kumatha kubweretsa zomwe angaganize kuti ndizozunza ndipo si zachilendo kutsatiridwa, kugwidwa mkono, ndi zina zotero.

en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
ny: Khalani olimba pokana amuna, ndipo musaope kuyimirira (kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kapena ayi, sikupangitsa kuti zikhale bwino!).

en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
ny: Mzinda wamakono wa Casablanca unakhazikitsidwa ndi asodzi a ku Berber m'zaka za m'ma 1000 BCE, ndipo ankagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi Afoinike, Aroma, ndi Merenids monga doko lodziwika bwino lotchedwa Anfa.

en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
ny: Apwitikizi anaiwononga ndi kuimanganso pansi pa dzina lakuti Casa Branca, koma anaisiya pambuyo pa chivomezi mu 1755.

en: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
ny: Sultan waku Morocco adamanganso mzindawu kukhala Daru l-Badya ndipo adautcha kuti Casablanca ndi amalonda aku Spain omwe adakhazikitsa malo ogulitsa kumeneko.

en: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
ny: Casablanca ndi amodzi mwa malo ochititsa chidwi kwambiri ku Morocco konse.

en: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
ny: Kuzungulira Medina yakale ndikosavuta kupeza malo ogulitsa zinthu zachikhalidwe zaku Moroccan, monga ma tagi, mbiya, katundu wachikopa, ma hookah, ndi mitundu yambiri ya geegaw, koma zonse ndi za alendo.

en: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
ny: Goma ndi mzinda woyendera alendo ku Democratic Republic of Congo kum'mawa kwambiri kufupi ndi Rwanda.

en: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.
ny: Mu 2002 Goma idawonongedwa ndi ziphalaphala zochokera kuphiri la Nyiragongo lomwe linakwirira misewu yambiri ya tauniyo, makamaka pakati pa tawuni.

en: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
ny: Ngakhale kuti Goma ndi yotetezeka, maulendo aliwonse kunja kwa Goma ayenera kufufuzidwa kuti amvetse momwe nkhondo ikupitirirabe m'chigawo cha North Kivu.

en: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
ny: Mzindawu ndiyenso poyambira kukwera phiri la Nyiragongo limodzi ndi njira zotsika mtengo kwambiri za Gorilla zamapiri ku Africa.

en: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
ny: Mutha kugwiritsa ntchito boda-boda (taxi yanjinga yamoto) kuzungulira Goma. Mtengo wanthawi zonse (wako) ndi ~ 500 Francs waku Congo paulendo waufupi.

en: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
ny: Kuphatikizidwa ndi kusafikirika kwake, "Timbuktu" idagwiritsidwa ntchito ngati fanizo la mayiko akutali, akutali.

en: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
ny: Masiku ano, Timbuktu ndi tawuni yosauka, ngakhale mbiri yake imapangitsa kuti ikhale yokopa alendo, ndipo ili ndi eyapoti.

en: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
ny: Mu 1990, idawonjezeredwa pamndandanda wamalo olowa padziko lonse lapansi omwe ali pachiwopsezo, chifukwa cha kuwopseza mchenga wa m'chipululu.

en: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
ny: Inali imodzi mwazoyima zazikulu panthawi ya Henry Louis Gates ya PBS yapadera ya Wonders of the African World.

en: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
ny: Mzindawu ndi wosiyana kwambiri ndi mizinda ina yonse ya m’dzikoli, chifukwa uli ndi luso la Chiarabu kuposa la munthu wa ku Africa.

en: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
ny: Kruger National Park (KNP) ili kumpoto-kummawa kwa South Africa ndipo imadutsa malire a Mozambique kummawa, Zimbabwe kumpoto, ndipo malire akumwera ndi Crocodile River.

en: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
ny: Pakiyi ili ndi 19,500 km² ndipo imagawidwa m'malo 14 osiyanasiyana, iliyonse imathandizira nyama zakuthengo zosiyanasiyana.

en: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
ny: Ndi imodzi mwazokopa kwambiri ku South Africa ndipo imatengedwa kuti ndi malo otchuka a South African National Parks (SANParks).

en: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
ny: Monga momwe zilili ndi ma Parks onse a South Africa National Park, pali zolipiritsa tsiku ndi tsiku komanso zolipira zolowera pakiyi.

en: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
ny: Kungakhalenso kopindulitsa kuti munthu agule Wild Card, yomwe imakupatsirani mwayi wolowera kumapaki osankhidwa ku South Africa kapena ku South Africa National Parks.

en: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
ny: Chilumba cha Hong Kong chimapereka gawo la Hong Kong dzina lake ndipo ndi malo omwe alendo ambiri amawaona kuti ndi ofunika kwambiri.

en: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
ny: Chiwonetsero cha nyumba zomwe zimapanga malo okongola a Hong Kong akuyerekezedwa ndi tchati chonyezimira chomwe chimawonekera chifukwa cha kupezeka kwa madzi a Victoria Harbor.

en: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
ny: Kuti muwone bwino za Hong Kong, chokani pachilumbachi ndikupita kumtsinje wa Kowloon.

en: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
ny: Zambiri zamatawuni aku Hong Kong Island ndizodzaza ndi malo olandilidwa m'mphepete mwa nyanja kumpoto.

en: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
ny: Awa ndi malo omwe atsamunda aku Britain adatenga ngati awo ndiye ngati mukuyang'ana umboni wakale wautsamunda wa derali, awa ndi malo abwino oyambira.

en: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
ny: Ma Sundarbans ndiye lamba wamkulu kwambiri wa mangrove padziko lonse lapansi, wotambasula 80 km (50 mi) kupita ku Bangladeshi ndi India hinterland kuchokera kugombe.

en: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
ny: The Sundarbans adalengezedwa kuti ndi UNESCO World Heritage Site. Gawo la nkhalango mkati mwa gawo la India limatchedwa Sundarbans National Park.

en: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
ny: Nkhalango sizimangokhala madambo a mangrove - zimaphatikizansopo nkhalango zotsalira za nkhalango zamphamvu zomwe kale zidaphimba chigwa cha Gangetic.

en: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
ny: Ma Sundarbans amatenga malo a 3,850 km², omwe pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu aliwonse amakhala ndi madzi / madambo.

en: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
ny: Kuyambira 1966 a Sundarbans akhala malo osungira nyama zakuthengo, ndipo akuti tsopano pali akambuku a Royal Bengal 400 ndi agwape pafupifupi 30,000 am'deralo.

en: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
ny: Mabasi amanyamuka pokwerera mabasi azigawo (kuwoloka mtsinje) tsiku lonse, ngakhale ambiri, makamaka omwe akupita kummawa ndipo Jakar/Bumthang amanyamuka pakati pa 06:30 ndi 07:30.

en: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
ny: Popeza mabasi azigawo nthawi zambiri amakhala odzaza, ndikofunikira kugula tikiti pasadakhale masiku angapo.

en: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
ny: Maboma ambiri amathandizidwa ndi Mabasi ang'onoang'ono aku Japan a Coaster, omwe ndi omasuka komanso olimba.

en: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
ny: Ma taxi ogawana nawo ndi njira yachangu komanso yabwino yopitira kumalo apafupi, monga Paro (Nu 150) ndi Punakha (Nu 200).

en: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
ny: Oyapock River Bridge ndi mlatho wokhala ndi chingwe. Imadutsa mtsinje wa Oyapock kulumikiza mizinda ya Oiapoque ku Brazil ndi Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock ku French Guiana.

en: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
ny: Zinsanja ziwirizi zimatalika mpaka mamita 83, kutalika kwake ndi mamita 378 ndipo zili ndi misewu iwiri ya 3.50 mamita m’lifupi.

en: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
ny: Chilolezo choyima pansi pa mlatho ndi 15 metres. Ntchito yomanga idamalizidwa mu Ogasiti 2011, sikunatsegulidwe mpaka Marichi 2017.

en: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
ny: Mlathowu uyenera kugwira ntchito mokwanira mu Seputembara 2017, pomwe malo oyendera anthu aku Brazil akuyembekezeka kutha.

en: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
ny: Anthu amtundu wa Guaraní anali anthu odziwika bwino kwambiri omwe amakhala kudera lomwe masiku ano amatchedwa Kum'mawa kwa Paraguay, omwe amakhala ngati alenje oyendayenda omwe amalimanso kuti azingolima.

en: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
ny: Dera la Chaco linali ndi magulu ena amitundu ya eni eni monga Guaycurú ndi Payaguá, omwe ankapulumuka mwa kusaka, kusonkhanitsa ndi kusodza.

en: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
ny: M'zaka za m'ma 1600 Paraguay, yomwe kale inkatchedwa "Chigawo Chachimphona cha Indies", idabadwa chifukwa chokumana ndi ogonjetsa aku Spain ndi magulu amtundu wawo.

en: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
ny: Anthu a ku Spain anayamba nthawi yautsamunda yomwe inatha zaka mazana atatu.

en: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
ny: Chiyambireni kukhazikitsidwa kwa Asunción mu 1537, Paraguay yakwanitsa kusunga chikhalidwe chake komanso chikhalidwe chake.

en: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
ny: Argentina imadziwika bwino chifukwa chokhala ndi imodzi mwamagulu abwino kwambiri a polo komanso osewera padziko lonse lapansi.

en: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
ny: Mpikisano waukulu kwambiri pachaka umachitika mu Disembala m'mabwalo a polo ku Las Cañitas.

en: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
ny: Masewera ang'onoang'ono ndi machesi amatha kuwoneka pano nthawi zina pachaka.

en: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
ny: Kuti mudziwe zambiri zamasewera komanso komwe mungagule matikiti amasewera a polo, onani Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

en: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
ny: Ndalama yovomerezeka ya Falklands ndi Falkland mapaundi (FKP) yomwe mtengo wake ndi wofanana ndi paundi imodzi yaku Britain (GBP).

en: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
ny: Ndalama zitha kusinthidwa ku banki yokhayo kuzilumba zomwe zili ku Stanley kudutsa sitolo ya FIC West.

en: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
ny: Mapaundi aku Britain amavomerezedwa kulikonse kuzilumbazi ndipo mkati mwa makhadi a ngongole a Stanley ndi madola aku United States amavomerezedwanso nthawi zambiri.

en: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
ny: Pazilumba zakutali makadi a ngongole sangavomerezedwe, ngakhale kuti ndalama za Britain ndi United States zingatengedwe; fufuzani ndi eni ake pasadakhale kuti mudziwe njira yovomerezeka yolipira.

en: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
ny: Ndizosatheka kusinthanitsa ndalama za Falklands kunja kwa zilumbazi, kotero kusinthana ndalama musanachoke kuzilumbazi.

en: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
ny: Popeza Montevideo ili kumwera kwa Equator, ndi chilimwe kumeneko kukakhala nyengo yachisanu ku Northern Hemisphere ndi mosemphanitsa.

en: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
ny: Montevideo ili ku subtropics; M'miyezi yachilimwe, kutentha pamwamba pa +30 ° C kumakhala kofala.

en: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
ny: Nthawi yozizira imatha kukhala yoziziritsa monyenga: kuzizira sikutsika kawirikawiri, koma mphepo ndi chinyezi zimaphatikizana kuti zimve kuzizira kuposa zomwe thermometer imanena.

en: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
ny: Palibe nyengo "yamvula" ndi "youma": kuchuluka kwa mvula kumakhala kofanana chaka chonse.

en: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
ny: Ngakhale kuti nyama zambiri za m’nkhalangoyi zazolowera kuona anthu, nyama zakuthengo n’zoti siziyenera kudyetsedwa kapena kusokonezedwa.

en: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
ny: Malinga ndi akuluakulu a paki, khalani osachepera mayadi 100/mamita kutali ndi zimbalangondo ndi mimbulu ndi mayadi 25/mita kuchokera ku nyama zina zonse zakutchire!

en: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
ny: Ngakhale zitakhala zofatsa bwanji, njati, mphalapala, mphalapala, zimbalangondo, ndi pafupifupi nyama zazikulu zonse zimatha kuukira.

en: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
ny: Chaka chilichonse, alendo ambiri amavulala chifukwa sanapite patali. Nyamazi ndi zazikulu, zakutchire, komanso zoopsa kwambiri, choncho zipatseni malo.

en: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
ny: Kuphatikiza apo, dziwani kuti fungo limakopa zimbalangondo ndi nyama zina zakuthengo, choncho pewani kunyamula kapena kuphika zakudya zonunkhiza ndikusunga msasa waukhondo.

en: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
ny: Apia ndi likulu la Samoa. Tawuniyi ili pachilumba cha Upolu ndipo ili ndi anthu ochepera 40,000.

en: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
ny: Apia idakhazikitsidwa m'ma 1850s ndipo lakhala likulu la boma la Samoa kuyambira 1959.

en: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
ny: Padokoli panali kulimbana koopsa kwa asilikali apanyanja mu 1889 pamene zombo zisanu ndi ziwiri zochokera ku Germany, US, ndi Britain zinakana kuchoka padokolo.

en: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
ny: Zombo zonse zinamira, kupatulapo ngalawa imodzi ya ku Britain. Pafupifupi miyoyo 200 ya ku America ndi Germany inatayika.

en: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
ny: Panthawi yomenyera ufulu wodzilamulira yomwe gulu la Mau lidakonza, msonkhano wamtendere mtawuniyi udapangitsa kuphedwa kwa mfumu yayikulu Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.

en: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
ny: Pali magombe ambiri, chifukwa chakuyenda kwa Auckland pamadoko awiri. Odziwika kwambiri ali m'madera atatu.

en: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
ny: Magombe aku North Shore (m'chigawo cha North Harbor) ali panyanja ya Pacific ndipo amachokera ku Long Bay kumpoto mpaka ku Devonport kumwera.

en: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
ny: Pafupifupi magombe onse amchenga omwe amasambira motetezeka, ndipo ambiri amakhala ndi mithunzi yoperekedwa ndi mitengo ya pohutukawa.

en: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
ny: Magombe a Tamaki Drive ali pa Waitemata Harbor, m'malo okwera a Mission Bay ndi St Heliers ku Central Auckland.

en: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
ny: Awa ndi magombe odzaza mabanja omwe nthawi zina amakhala ndi mashopu ambiri omwe amakhala m'mphepete mwa nyanja. Kusambira ndi kotetezeka.

en: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
ny: Mowa waukulu wa m'deralo ndi 'Number One', si mowa wovuta, koma wokoma komanso wotsitsimula. Mowa wina wakumeneko umatchedwa "Manta".

en: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
ny: Pali mavinyo ambiri aku France oti akhale nawo, koma vinyo waku New Zealand ndi waku Australia amatha kuyenda bwino.

en: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
ny: Madzi apampopi am'deralo ndi abwino kumwa, koma madzi a m'mabotolo ndi osavuta kupeza ngati mukuwopa.

en: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
ny: Kwa anthu aku Australia, lingaliro la khofi la 'flat white' ndi lachilendo. Wakuda wamfupi ndi 'espresso', cappuccino imabwera itadzaza ndi zonona (osati thovu), ndipo tiyi amaperekedwa popanda mkaka.

en: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
ny: Chokoleti yotentha imakhala ndi miyezo ya ku Belgium. Madzi a zipatso ndi okwera mtengo koma abwino kwambiri.

en: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
ny: Maulendo ambiri opita ku matanthwe amapangidwa chaka chonse, ndipo kuvulala chifukwa chazifukwa zonsezi pamphepete mwa nyanjayi sichitika kawirikawiri.

en: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
ny: Komabe, tsatirani malangizo kuchokera kwa akuluakulu a boma, mverani zizindikiro zonse, ndipo tcherani khutu ku machenjezo okhudza chitetezo.

en: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
ny: Box jellyfish amapezeka pafupi ndi magombe ndi pafupi ndi magombe a mitsinje kuyambira October mpaka April kumpoto kwa 1770. Nthawi zina amapezeka kunja kwa nthawizi.

en: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
ny: Shark alipo, komabe saukira anthu kawirikawiri. Nsomba zambiri zimachita mantha ndi anthu ndipo zikanasambira.

en: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
ny: Ng'ona za m'madzi amchere sizikhala m'nyanja, malo awo enieni ali m'mphepete mwa mitsinje kumpoto kuchokera ku Rockhampton.

en: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
ny: Kusungitsatu malo kumapatsa wapaulendo mtendere wamumtima kuti adzakhala ndi malo ogona akadzafika kumene akupita.

en: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
ny: Othandizira oyendayenda nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi zochita ndi mahotela enaake, ngakhale mutha kupeza kotheka kusungitsa malo ena ogona, monga malo ochitirako misasa, kudzera mwa wothandizira maulendo.

en: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
ny: Othandizira maulendo nthawi zambiri amapereka phukusi lomwe limaphatikizapo chakudya cham'mawa, mayendedwe opita / kuchokera ku eyapoti kapena ngakhale phukusi lophatikizana la ndege ndi hotelo.

en: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
ny: Atha kukusungiraninso malo ngati mukufuna nthawi yoganizira zomwe mwapeza kapena kugula zikalata zina za komwe mukupita (monga visa).

en: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
ny: Zosintha zilizonse kapena zopempha ziyenera kutumizidwa kaye ndi wothandizira maulendo osati ku hoteloyo.

en: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
ny: Pa zikondwerero zina, ambiri mwa omwe amapita ku zikondwerero za nyimbo amasankha kumanga msasa pamalopo, ndipo otumikira ambiri amawona kuti ndi gawo lofunika kwambiri pazochitikazo.

en: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
ny: Ngati mukufuna kukhala pafupi ndi zomwe mukuchita muyenera kulowa molawirira kuti mupeze malo amsasa pafupi ndi nyimbo.

en: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
ny: Kumbukirani kuti ngakhale nyimbo pazigawo zazikulu zingakhale zitatha, pangakhale zigawo za chikondwererocho zomwe zidzapitirizabe kuyimba nyimbo mpaka pakati pa usiku.

en: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
ny: Zikondwerero zina zimakhala ndi misasa yapadera ya mabanja omwe ali ndi ana aang'ono.

en: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
ny: Ngati muwoloka kumpoto kwa Baltic m'nyengo yozizira, yang'anani komwe kuli kanyumbako, chifukwa kudutsa mu ayezi kumayambitsa phokoso lowopsa kwa omwe akhudzidwa kwambiri.

en: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
ny: Maulendo apanyanja a Saint Petersburg amaphatikiza nthawi mtawuni. Apaulendo apaulendo samasulidwa ku zofunikira za visa (onani zomwe zili).

en: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
ny: Makasino nthawi zambiri amayesetsa kukulitsa nthawi ndi ndalama zomwe alendo amawononga. Mawindo ndi mawotchi nthawi zambiri palibe, ndipo zotuluka zimakhala zovuta kupeza.

en: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
ny: Nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi chakudya chapadera, zakumwa ndi zosangalatsa zomwe amapereka, kuti alendo azikhala osangalala, ndikuwasunga pamalopo.

en: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
ny: Malo ena amapereka zakumwa zoledzeretsa panyumbapo. Komabe, kuledzera kumasokoneza kuganiza bwino, ndipo otchova njuga onse amadziŵa kufunika kokhala osaledzeretsa.

en: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
ny: Aliyense amene adzayendetsa galimoto pamalo okwera kwambiri kapena m'njira zamapiri ayenera kuganizira za kuthekera kwa chipale chofewa, madzi oundana, kapena kuzizira kwambiri.

en: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
ny: M'misewu yachipale chofewa komanso yachipale chofewa, mikangano imakhala yochepa kwambiri ndipo simungayendetse ngati muli pa phula lopanda kanthu.

en: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
ny: M'nyengo ya mvula yamkuntho, chipale chofewa chokwanira kuti mutseke chikhoza kugwa mu nthawi yochepa kwambiri.

en: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
ny: Kuwoneka kungathenso kuchepetsedwa ndi kugwa kapena kuwomba chipale chofewa kapena ndi condensation kapena ayezi pamawindo agalimoto.

en: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
ny: Kumbali ina, m'mayiko ambiri mumakhala chipale chofewa, ndipo magalimoto amayenda mosadodometsedwa chaka chonse.

en: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
ny: Safaris mwina ndiye chokopa chachikulu kwambiri ku Africa komanso chosangalatsa kwa alendo ambiri.

en: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
ny: Mawu akuti safari omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri amatanthauza kuyenda pamtunda kukawona nyama zakuthengo zaku Africa, makamaka pa savanna.

en: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
ny: Nyama zina, monga njovu ndi giraffes, zimakonda kuyandikira pafupi ndi magalimoto ndipo zida zodziwika bwino zimalola kuwonera bwino.

en: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
ny: Mikango, akalulu ndi akambuku nthawi zina amachita manyazi ndipo umawawona bwino ndi ma binoculars.

en: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk", "hiking safari", or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
ny: Ulendo woyenda (womwe umatchedwanso "bush walk", "hiking safari", kapena "kuyenda") umakhala ndi kuyenda, mwina kwa maola angapo kapena masiku angapo.

en: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
ny: Masewera a olimpiki adzachitika kuyambira 24 August mpaka 5 September 2021. Zochitika zina zidzachitikira m'madera ena ku Japan konse.

en: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
ny: Tokyo ikhala mzinda wokhawo waku Asia womwe udachita nawo ma Olimpiki awiri achilimwe, atachititsa masewerawa mu 1964.

en: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
ny: Ngati mudasungitsa ndege zanu ndi malo ogona 2020 kuchedwetsa kusanalengedwe, mutha kukhala ndi zovuta.

en: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
ny: Mfundo zoletsa zimasiyana, koma pofika kumapeto kwa Marichi mfundo zambiri zolepheretseratu za coronavirus sizikupitilira Julayi 2020, pomwe Olimpiki idakonzedwa.

en: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
ny: Tikuyembekezeka kuti matikiti ambiri amisonkhano azikhala pakati pa ¥2,500 ndi ¥130,000, matikiti wamba amawononga pafupifupi ¥7,000.

en: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
ny: Kusita zovala zonyowa kungathandize kuti ziume. Mahotela ambiri ali ndi chitsulo ndi ironing board yomwe ilipo kuti abwereke ngongole, ngakhale m'chipindamo mulibemo.

en: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
ny: Ngati ayironi palibe, kapena ngati simukonda kuvala masokosi achisitani, mutha kuyesa kugwiritsa ntchito chowumitsira tsitsi ngati chilipo.

en: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
ny: Samalani kuti musalole kuti nsalu ikhale yotentha kwambiri (zomwe zingayambitse kuchepa, kapena nthawi zambiri, zipse).

en: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats.
ny: Pali njira zosiyanasiyana zoyeretsera madzi, zina zothandiza kwambiri polimbana ndi zoopsa zinazake.

en: In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed.
ny: M’madera ena madzi otentha kwa mphindi imodzi ndi okwanira, m’madera ena pamafunika mphindi zingapo.

en: Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.
ny: Zosefera zimasiyana mogwira mtima, ndipo ngati muli ndi nkhawa, muyenera kuganizira kugula madzi anu mu botolo losindikizidwa kuchokera ku kampani yodziwika bwino.

en: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions.
ny: Anthu apaulendo angakumane ndi tizilombo towononga tizilombo tomwe samazidziwa m'madera omwe kwawo.

en: Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections.
ny: Tizilombo toyambitsa matenda titha kuwononga chakudya, kuyambitsa kupsa mtima, kapena kuipitsitsa kwambiri kumayambitsa kusamvana, kufalitsa utsi, kapena kufalitsa matenda.

en: Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.
ny: Matenda opatsirana okha, kapena nyama zowopsa zomwe zingavulaze kapena kupha anthu mokakamiza, sizimayenerera kukhala tizilombo.

en: Duty free shopping is the opportunity to buy goods exempted from taxes and excises at certain locations.
ny: Kugula kwaulere ndi mwayi wogula katundu wosalipidwa pamisonkho ndi zotuluka m'malo ena.

en: Travellers bound for countries with heavy taxation can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, especially on products such as alcoholic beverages and tobacco.
ny: Anthu apaulendo opita kumayiko okhala ndi misonkho yambiri nthawi zina amatha kusunga ndalama zambiri, makamaka pazakumwa zoledzeretsa ndi fodya.

en: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain.
ny: Kutalikirana pakati pa Point Marion ndi Fairmont kumapereka zovuta zoyendetsa galimoto mumsewu wa Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, wodutsa pafupipafupi kudera lakutali la backwoods.

en: If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate.
ny: Ngati simunazolowere kuyendetsa galimoto m'misewu yakumidzi, samalani za inu: magiredi otsetsereka, tinjira tating'ono, komanso makhotakhota akuthwa.

en: Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise.
ny: Liwiro lotumizidwa ndi lotsika kwambiri kuposa zigawo zam'mbuyo ndi zotsatila - nthawi zambiri 35-40 mph (56-64 km / h) - ndipo kuwamvera mosamalitsa ndikofunikira kwambiri kuposa zina.

en: Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.
ny: Chodabwitsa, komabe, mafoni am'manja ndi amphamvu kwambiri pano kuposa njira zina zambiri, monga Pennsylvania Wilds.

en: German pastries are quite good, and in Bavaria, are quite rich and varied, similar to those of their southern neighbor, Austria.
ny: Zakudya za ku Germany ndizabwino kwambiri, ndipo ku Bavaria, ndizolemera komanso zosiyanasiyana, zofanana ndi za mnansi wawo wakumwera, Austria.

en: Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer.
ny: Zakudya za zipatso ndizofala, ndipo maapulo amaphikidwa mu makeke chaka chonse, ndipo yamatcheri ndi plums amawonekera m'chilimwe.

en: Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other tree nuts. Popular cakes often pair particularly well with a cup of strong coffee.
ny: Zakudya zambiri zophikidwa ku Germany zimakhalanso ndi amondi, mtedza wa hazelnut, ndi mtedza wina. Makeke otchuka nthawi zambiri amagwirizana makamaka ndi kapu ya khofi wamphamvu.

en: If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen.
ny: Ngati mukufuna makeke ang'onoang'ono ngakhale olemera, yesani zomwe malinga ndi dera zimatchedwa Berliner, Pfannkuchen kapena Krapfen.

en: A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables.
ny: Curry ndi chakudya chochokera ku zitsamba ndi zonunkhira, kuphatikizapo nyama kapena masamba.

en: A curry can be either "dry" or "wet" depending on the amount of liquid.
ny: Curry ikhoza kukhala "yowuma" kapena "yonyowa" malingana ndi kuchuluka kwa madzi.

en: In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used.
ny: M'madera akumidzi a Kumpoto kwa India ndi Pakistan, yogati imagwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri mu ma curries; Kum'mwera kwa India ndi madera ena a m'mphepete mwa nyanja ya subcontinent, mkaka wa kokonati umagwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri.

en: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation.
ny: Pokhala ndi zilumba 17,000 zomwe mungasankhe, chakudya cha ku Indonesia ndi ambulera yomwe imafotokoza zamitundu yosiyanasiyana yazakudya zomwe zimapezeka kudera lonselo.

en: But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java.
ny: Koma, ngati atagwiritsidwa ntchito popanda ziyeneretso zina, mawuwa amatanthauza chakudya chochokera kumadera apakati ndi kum'mawa kwa chilumba chachikulu Java.

en: Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.
ny: Tsopano zopezeka m'zisumbu zonse, zakudya za ku Javanese zimakhala ndi zakudya zingapo zokongoletsedwa bwino, zokometsera zomwe anthu a ku Javanese amakonda ndi mtedza, chilli, shuga (makamaka shuga wa kokonati waku Java) ndi zonunkhira zosiyanasiyana.

en: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle.
ny: Zokoka ndi zogwiriziza mapazi a wokwerapo amene akulendewera mbali zonse za chishalocho.

en: They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them.
ny: Amapereka kukhazikika kwakukulu kwa wokwerayo koma akhoza kukhala ndi nkhawa za chitetezo chifukwa cha kuthekera kwa mapazi a wokwera kuti atseke.

en: If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken.
ny: Ngati wokwera pahatchi waponyedwa pahatchi koma phazi lake lagwidwa ndi chipwirikiti, akhoza kumukokera ngati kavaloyo atathawa. Kuti muchepetse chiopsezochi, pali njira zingapo zodzitetezera.

en: First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole.
ny: Choyamba, okwera ambiri amavala nsapato zokwera ndi chidendene ndi chosalala, chopapatiza, chokhachokha.

en: Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.
ny: Kenako, zishalo zina, makamaka zishalo za Chingelezi, zimakhala ndi zotchingira zotetezera zomwe zimalola kuti chikopa chogwedeza chigwere pa chishalo ngati chikokedwa chambuyo ndi wokwera kugwa.

en: Cochamó Valley - Chile's premier climbing destination, known as the Yosemite of South America, with a variety of granite big walls and crags.
ny: Chigwa cha Cochamó - Malo okwera kwambiri ku Chile, omwe amadziwika kuti Yosemite waku South America, okhala ndi makoma akulu akulu akulu ndi miyala.

en: Summits include breath-taking views from peaks. Climbers from all parts of the world are continually establishing new routes amongst its endless potential of walls.
ny: Misonkhanoyi imakhala ndi mawonedwe ochititsa chidwi kuchokera kumapiri. Okwera kuchokera kumadera onse padziko lapansi akukhazikitsa njira zatsopano pakati pa makoma ake osatha.
